loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon M. is a 23-year-old man, married to Zipporah Wanjiku and together they have two school-going children. Simon has been operating a water vendor business for the last four years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. He has never borrowed from any micro-finance institution before and this will be his first loan. Joseph will use this loan to add more donkeys and donkey carts to transport and supply water to his ever increasing customers in Naivasha town.

His future aspiration is to own a plot of land and buy a pick-up car to supply water covering Naivasha town and its environs.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Adding more donkeys and donkey carts.

loans.name: Look Up To God Group

texts.en:
Look Up To God is a group of  5 borrowers led by Solomon G., 37 years old and a 10th grade drop-out due to lack of support. He is married with 5 children aged 6-16 years old and also cares for 2 siblings.

Solomon lives and work on Gurley Street, East of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Gurley Street is known to be a very rough street, where local night clubs, motels and liquor shops are located, therefore most parents in that community don’t care for their children well, which has a negative impact on their lives.

Solomon’s business is buying used clothing bales wholesale and selling them retail to the residents of Gurley Street. He started this business with a small amount of cash but with courage and seriousness, he is making his business move forward. Solomon has been running this business for 10 years and this business has been putting food on the table for him and his family for the past years. 

Solomon’s good human relations with his customers have allowed his business to reach this far. He needs this loan to purchase more used clothing bales wholesale to grow this business into a bigger one. His goal is to own a bigger shop and expand his business and he also dreams of taking good care of his family and giving them good living conditions and medical care so as to have long lives.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing bales wholesale

loans.name: Saiid

texts.en: Saiid is a 35-year-old married man with 2 children. He owns an aluminium shop to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Saiid is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy new tools for his work so he can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of 6 children. In 2007, she decided to sell clothes to the neighboring villages to provide, along with her husband, better living conditions for the family. Today, Ghada is applying for a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase additional clothes to satisfy the demand of her clientele, after becoming known by her clientele.

loans.use: purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en: Kayed is a 32-year-old man and father of 4 children. He has owned a specific Lebanese food kiosk since 1995. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Kayed is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to renovate his kiosk in order to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: renovate his kiosk

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has owned an accessories and perfume shop since 2003, in order to increase her income. Amale is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 27-year-old single woman living with her mother and sister. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2007 and has 6 years of experience in this field. Today, Darine is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase tools in order to develop her work and augment her income.

loans.use: purchase tools

loans.name: Only God Group

texts.en:
Only God is group of 5 borrowers led by Lafayette C., 58 years old and a junior high school drop-out due to poverty. He is married with 4 children aged 15-35 and their educational levels are 6th-11th grade.

Lafayette lives and work on Gurley Street, east of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Gurley Street is known to be a very rough street, where local night clubs, motels, and liquor shops are located, therefore most parents in that community don’t care for their children appropriately, and this has a negative impact on their lives.

Lafayette’s business is buying used clothing bales wholesale and selling the clothing retail to the residents of Gurley Street. He started this business with a small amount of capital but with courage and seriousness, he is making his business move forward.

Lafayette has been running this business for 22 years because it is what he feeds the family and pays his children's school fees from. Lafayette sells good quality clothing and has a good approach to customers; that is the secret to the growth of his business. He need this loan to purchase more used clothing bales wholesale to grow this business into a bigger one.

Lafayette’s goal is to own a used clothing store and expand. His dream is to give his children a quality education and improve his own and his family’s lives.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing bales wholesale

loans.name: Khajak

texts.en: Khajak is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a mini-market since 2006 to earn income to help satisfy, in collaboration with his parents, the needs of the family. Today, Khajak is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a laptop for the accounting and the inventory of his shop in order to develop his work.

loans.use: purchase a laptop

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Haroutyoun

texts.en: Haroutyoun is a 33-year-old single man living with his mother. He has been working as a car spare distributor since 2008 and has 14 years of experience in this field; he works hard to provide better living conditions for his mother. Today, Haroutyoun is requesting to borrow US$ 600 to renovate his motorcycle to facilitate his delivery trips.

loans.use: renovate his motorcycle

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
K. Joseph is a very hard-working and honest man. He is a businessman involved in shoe making and repair and he has been transacting his businesses from Mubende Town council for 12 years. He is 31 years old and married with 2 children both in primary section, and he takes care of other 2 dependents. Over the years, he has been able to increase his customer base because of the experience he has and as a result, he is able to make 300,000/= in profit a month.

Joseph has a dream of buying a shoe-making machine to make his work easier and faster as well as building his own house so he can stop renting. Joseph needs a loan so that he will be able to boost his business by buying new products like thread, shoe soles, heels, rubber, and so on.

loans.use: Buying materials for making shoes like thread, shoe soles, heels, rubber and many others.

loans.name: God With Group

texts.en:
God With Them is a group of 5 borrowers led by Bandu K., 32 years old, married, with 4 children aged 8-14 years old; their educational levels 1st-7th grade. Bandu is a high school graduate but because of lack of support, she couldn’t go to university. She lives in the Saye town community. It is north of Monrovia, Liberia, and it is a very crowded and poor community that got shattered by the civil war.

Bandu’s business is to sell prepared food. She buys food items like rice, oil, seasoning, pepper, and other ingredients, cook and sells per plate to the residents of Saye town.

She started this business with funds she borrowed and been running this business for 1 year. Bandu prepares her food nicely in order to maintain her clientele and get more customers. She wants the loan to purchase more food ingredients and items to serve her customers and acquire more profit.

Bandu wants to grow her food preparation business to owning a big restaurant in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Bandu dreams of herself and her entire family living in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients and items to serve her customers

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis P. vive en casa propia con su hijo en la calle Rigoberto Paredes de la zona de San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz; su ingreso es una renta de jubilación que le dejó la esposa al morir;  percibe también  alquileres de dos habitaciones.
 
Tiene instalado en su casa un taller de costura, donde confecciona trajes de vestir para caballeros y damas. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material, como ser telas, hilos botones y otros, para continuar con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004 con un  muy bueno historial de pagos, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Luis P. lives in his own house with his son on Rigoberto Paredes Street in the San Pedro Zone in the city of La Paz. He has income from a retirement annuity that his wife left him when she passed away. He also rents out two rooms. He has a sewing workshop in his house where he makes men's and women's suits. He is seeking a loan to buy materials such as fabrics, thread, buttons, etc., so he can stay in business and increase his income. Luis has been an Impro client since 2004. He has a very good payment history so he can apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, buttons and other supplies for his business making men's and women's suits.

loans.name: Airfield Short Cut Group

texts.en:
Airfield Short Cut is a group of 5 borrowers led by Edwina D., 35 years old and also a junior student of the Smart Institute (an academy and training college). She is a single mother with 4 children aged 9-18 years old; their educational levels are 4th-10th grade. She also cares for 4 siblings.

Edwina lives in the Airfield Shortcut area. It is north of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. It’s a community with mixed poor and middle class Liberians.

Edwina’s business is, she buys charcoal wholesale and sells retail to the residents of Airfield Shortcut. She has been running this business for 3 years and she is grateful to this business because both her own and the children’s school fees and their food comes from her business.

Edwina started this business with a small amount of capital but now owns a warehouse and wants to go forward and expand her business. Her good relations with her customers made her reach this far, and she wants to become a big businesswoman, travelling out of country to bring different kinds of goods to Liberia.

Edwina needs the loan to purchase more charcoal to fill her warehouse and make more profit to increase her capital. She dreams of graduating from university and giving her children a education for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to fill her warehouse

loans.name: Fanny Manuela

texts.es: Fanny Manuela es casada, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, la mayor de 12 añitos de edad estudia su sexto grado de educaciòn primaria y una bebe de 2 añitos de edad, vive en  la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea, labora en la  Esc. Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell  desde hace 10 años,  esta solicitando su 2do credito crèdito esperando ser beneficado con el fondo KIVA, para poder finalizar las mejoras que ha venido haciendo en su casa construyendo un pantry y de esta forma tener un casa con buenas condiciones para su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de  su esposo quien trabaja en la alcaldia municipal y por la noche como docente de educaciòn primaria, ambos comparten los gastos familiares y los compromisos adquiridos, ellos son una familia bien humildes, pero bien unida, el sueño de Fanny Manuela es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones para que sus hijas se desarrollen en un ambiente agradable , tener salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Fanny Manuela is married and has two children. The oldest is 12, and she is in sixth grade in elementary school. The baby is two years old. She lives in the Zona #7 de Nueva Guinea. She has worked at the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell School for ten years. She is asking for her second loan. She is hoping to benefit from KIVA funds to be able to finish improvements she has been making on her house. She is building a pantry in order to have a house in good condition for her family. She counts on her husband’s support. He works in the municipal town hall, and at night he works as an elementary school teacher. They both share the family expenses and commitments they have acquired. They are a very humble family, but they are very united. Fanny Manuela’s dreams are to have a house with better conditions so that her daughters develop in a pleasant atmosphere, to be healthy, and to have work stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a pantry

loans.name: Gertrude's Group

texts.en: N. Gertrude is the leader of her lending group in Mubende. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children aged between 28 – 12 years and she takes care of 2 other dependents. She is a businesswoman with a retail shop in Kyenda, Kitenga subcounty that she has been running for 5 years and she is able to make reasonable profit that helps to look after her family and put aside some savings. She is a friendly and hard-working lady and this is key in her good customer care skills. She needs a loan to be able to pay her children’s school fees and for restocking her shop with more products.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children and restocking her retail shop

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.en:
The “Victoire” or “Victory” Group is made up of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. They are all excited about receiving their firS. loan to expand their current businesses. The group has a wide range of businesses from charcoal to cosmetics and from clothing to small boutiques. Thelot K. is one of three representatives of the group. He is a 27-year-old husband and father to one child.

The hardworking young man is the owner of a small boutique that sells un-prepared food, cold drinks, and phone cards, as well as other household necessities. He plans on investing the loan in his current business and hopes to be able to sell in bulk one day. Higher volume sales would improve the economic conditions for himself and his family, which is a top priority. On behalf of Thelot, Victoire, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: rice, oil, drinks, phone cards

loans.name: Felicita Gloria

texts.es: Felicita Gloria esta solicitando su segundo credito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en construcciòn de  una habitación para asi tener mas comodidad, trabaja como docente desde hace 4 años en la Escuela Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell, tiene 2 hijos, la mayor tiene 17 años de edad estudia su quinto año de educaciòn secundaria, el otro niño tiene  15 años de edad estudia  su segundo año de secundaria ,  su compañero de vida trabaja en la finca ambos comparten con los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos con AFODENIC, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos se caracterizan por ser muy responsables y humildes, esta familia son muy queridos por su comunidad ya que esta maestra  imparte el pan de la enseñanza a los niños mas necesitados de la comunidad, su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita para su familia.
texts.en:
Felicita Gloria is asking for her second loan from AFODENIC. She wants to build a room to be more comfortable. She has worked for four years as a teacher at the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell School. She has two children. The oldest in 17 and is in his fifth year of high school. The other child is 15 and is in his second year of high school. Her life partner works on the farm. They both share the household expenses and the commitments they have acquired. In spite of being a family with scant economic resources, they can be characterized as being very responsible and humble. This family is very loved by their community. This teacher teaches the most needy children in the community. Her dreams are to have good health, work, and an attractive house for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Don Francisco Antonio esta solicitando su 7mo  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo  en la construir una habitaciòn, trabaja como obrero de Campo en el INTA de Nueva Guinea desde hace 8 años, tiene 2 hijos estudiando su primaria, vive en la zona # 3 en Nueva Guinea,  se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable  para con  sus hijos, los enseño a trabajar y a estudiar para ser personas de bien, su esposa se encarga del cuido de sus hijos y de los quehaceres del hogar,  es muy querido en su centro de trabajo por ser una persona de buen vivir, responsable, trabajador y  sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y llegar a conocer a sus nietos, salud y que su familia siempre permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Francisco Antonio is asking for his 7th loan with AFODENIC to build a room. For eight years he has been a field worker for INTA (Nicaraguan Institute for Agricultural Technology) of Nueva Guinea. He has two children who attend elementary school. He lives in the Zona #3 in Nueva Guinea. He is characterized as being a very responsible man with his children. He taught them to work and to study to be good, decent people. His wife is in charge of taking care of the children and the household chores. In his work center he is very well liked for being a person who lives right, is responsible, hard-working, and friendly in his community. His dreams are to improve their living conditions, come to know his grandchildren, to have good health, and that his family always stays united.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: God Bless You Club #2 Group

texts.en:
God Bless You Club #2 is a group of 4 borrowers led by Fatu J., 47 years old, married with 4 children aged 6-26 years old; their educational levels 3rd-11th grade. She also cares for her siblings. Fatu is also a high school graduate but didn't have the opportunity to further her education because of poverty. Fatu lives on Benson Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia but living in poverty.


Fatu’s business is her dry goods shop. She buys wholesale and sells provisions like sugar, candles, matches, Maggi, insecticides, etc.,  retail. She has been running this business for 6 years and she started with a very small amount of capital but now runs a shop. 

Because Fatu’s husband does not have job anymore, she takes care of all the expenses in her home.
By buying better goods and arranging them in an orderly fashion in the shop, she attracts customers and makes them always want to come and buy from her.

Fatu needs this loan to purchase more dry goods like rice, sugar, candles, etc. to make more profit;
 her goal is to establish bigger shops in and around Monrovia, Liberia. Fatu also dreams of improving her own and her family's lives and seeing them become better people in society.

loans.use: Fatu needs this loan to purchase more dry goods like rice, sugar, candles, etc. to make more profit

loans.name: Bolokolognite Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bolokolognite est constitué de cinq femmes  toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des  familles polygames à Mancourani 1  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt de groupe, tous les  trois précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Elles exercent comme activité  l’achat et la vente de médicaments, de vêtements  pour enfants, du charbon de bois, des produits cosmétiques, des tasses etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 emballages de médicaments, 4 douzaines d’habits pour enfants, 70 sacs de charbon de bois, 2 cartons de produits cosmétiques,  3 douzaines de tasses en plastique. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les différents marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 30.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres  ouvrir un magasin de vente.
texts.en:
The Bolokolognite group is made up of five women, who are all married and on average are 35 years old, have 3 children and live in polygamous families in Mancourani 1, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. This is their fourth group loan. All three previous loans were repaid without difficulties. They buy and sell medicines, children's clothing, wood coal, cosmetics, cups, etc. With their new loan, they plan to purchase 5 packages of medicine, 4 dozen children's outfits, 70 sacks of wood coal, 2 cartons of cosmetics, and 3 dozen plastic cups. They get their supplies in the Sikasso marketplace and in the neighboring villages. They sell in the city of Sikasso in the various markets and in the neighborhoods in a traveling manner. They sell for cash or often on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. They each envision making a monthly profit of 30,500 CFA francs, of which a portion will be used for savings and family needs, and the other portion will be invested in their activities. Some of them plan to purchase a plot of land to live on in Sikasso and others plan to open a store.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items.

loans.name: Siguikame Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Siguikame sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani 1,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. Tous les quatre précédents se sont bien dénoués. Elles font de la vente de   médicaments,  des vêtements  pour enfants, de la  pomme de terre, des ignames et  des pagnes wax.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 emballages de médicaments, 4 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants, 4 pièces de pagnes wax et 11 sacs de pomme de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville auprès des grossistes et dans les villages avoisinants auprès des producteurs. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville  dans les différents  marchés et dans les quartiers  de façon ambulante, au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres ouvrir un magasin de vente.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the Siguikame group are all married and are on average 25 years old, with 2 children. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Mancourani 1, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. This is their fourth group loan. All of the four previous loans have been well resolved. They sell medicine, children's clothing, potatoes, yams and Wax brand pagnes (lengths of brightly colored fabric). With their new loan, they plan to purchase 5 packages of medicine, 4 dozen children's outfits, 4 lengths of Wax pagnes and 11 sacks of potatoes. They get their supplies in the Sikasso market from wholesale distributors and in the neighboring villages. They sell in Sikasso for cash or often on credit, in the various markets and in the neighborhoods in a traveling manner, to a clientele composed of men and women. They each envision making a monthly profit of 32,500 FCA francs, of which a portion will be used for savings and for family needs, and the other portion will be invested in their activities. Several of them plan to purchase a plot of land to live on in Sikasso, and others plan to open a store.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells provisions and drinks. She is 34 years old and married. She has been with LAPO for many years. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell and make more money for her family's upkeep. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr: A. Agathe est née le 31/07/1978 à Pobè. Agathe est mariée à AHOUNOU Raphaël. Agathe est mère deux enfants mais elle a un autre enfant qui n’est pas d’elle aussi à charge en plus des tiens. Agathe vit avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Agathe fait la couture mais vend en plus des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Agathe achète ses articles à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin et les vend à Djègan Daho à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN.  Agathe a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé pour faire évoluer son activité. Agathe a bien remboursé ces crédits et elle sollicite un autre aujourd’hui pour mieux développer son activité couture.
texts.en:
Agathe A. was born on 31/07/1978 in the city of Pobe. Agathe is married to Raphael Ahounou. Agathe is mother of two children but she has anonther in her care that is not her child. Agath lives with her children and she is the sole breadwinner of the family. Agathe is a seamstress but she also sells various items (candies, cookies, boxes of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pastas, laundry detergents, dish soaps, beauty bars, batteries, candles etc.). Agatha purchases her inventory in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin, and she resells them in the Djegan Daho district of Porto-Novo, capital city of Benin. Agathe has had two previous loans with Alide (Kiva Field Partner) to benefit her business. Agathe has never had problems repaying her loans, and so she requests a new loan to improve her seamstress business.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tailoring tools.

loans.name: Gnemogognouman Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Gnèmogognouman, (huit femmes dont  5 mariées  et 3 veuves) avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants,  vivent dans des  foyers majoritairement monogames à FAMA  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents.
 Elles font de  la vente de  condiments alimentaires,  des fruits et légumes, des céréales et de l’atiéké.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 8 paniers de condiments alimentaires, 5 colis de légumes  et  300 kg d’atiéké. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent dans les différents marchés de la ville de Sikasso et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, généralement au comptant et quelques rare fois à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille,  l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent aider leur mari dans la construction de leur lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres  agrandir  leur activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Gnèmogognouman group, (eight women of which 5 are married and 3 are widows) are on average 37 years old with 4 children, and live as a majority in monogamous homes in FAMA, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to satisfy the needs of their customers, and this is their third group loan, after correctly repaying the two preceding loans. They sell seasonings, fruits and vegetables, cereals, and atiéké (granulated cassava root). With their new loan, they plan to purchase 8 baskets of seasonings, 5 parcels of vegetables and 300 kg of atiéké. They get their supplies in the Sikasso marketplace and in the neighboring villages. They sell in the various Sikasso markets and in the neighborhoods in a traveling manner, usually for cash and on rare occasions on credit to a clientele made up of men and women. They each envision making a profit of 35,000 CFA francs, of which a portion will be used for savings and for family needs, and the other portion will be reinvested in their activities. Some of them plan to help their husbands with the construction on their home plot in Sikasso and others plan to enlarge their business.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat food products.

loans.name: Akominassi

texts.fr: G. Akominassi est née vers 1961 à Zoungbomé. Elle est mariée à GBODOGBE Agloglo. Elle est mère de deux enfants ; mais en plus de ses enfants elle a trois autres enfants à charge. Elle vit avec ces cinq enfants à charge à Zoungbomè à P. Elle produit de l’huile rouge ; elle vend aussi des fruits et de vivres et des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Elle achète ses produits à Zoungbomè et les vend à Ouando.  Elle a d déjà trente ans d’expérience dans son activité. Elle a déjà deux crédits d’ALIDé ; elle a bien remboursé ces crédits.  Actuellement, elle demande un troisième crédit pour augmenter le volume de ses activités afin de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
G. Akominassi is born around 1961 in Zoungbome. She is married to GBODOGBE Agloglo. She is the mother of two children, but in addition to her children, she has three other children to take care of. She lives with her five children that she takes care of in Zoungbome in Porto-Novo. She makes palm oil and she also sells fruits, foodstuff and various items( candies, cookies, boxes of milk,sardine, tomatoes, sugar, pastries, laundry, dishwashing and bathroom soap, batteries, candles, etc). She buys her goods in Zoungbome and sells them in Ouando. She already has thirty years of experience in her business. She has already two loans from ALIDE and repaid correctly these loans.She is currently requesting a third loan to augment the bulk of her business in order to meet effectively the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts and bananas

loans.name: Women We Trust Group

texts.en:
Women We Trust is a group of 4 borrowers led by Kpana F.. Kpana is a 48-year-old woman who is married, with five children. Her children aged 5-20 years old, and their educational levels from 1st-10th grade. Kpana also cares for two siblings.

Kpana did not have an education because during the early 1960`s the people of Lofa County, where Kpana migrated from, did not believe in educating women. The people believed that men should be responsible for every expense in the home. 

Kpana lives and sells in the Lakpazee community, South of down town Monrovia, Liberia. It is a community that is like a slum, and the rate of poverty is very high. An entire family lives on $2.00 US a day. 

Kpana’s business is buying palm oil in gallons, and sells in bottles to residents of Southern Monrovia, Liberia. Kpana started this business with one gallon of palm oil, but she was serious and  was focused, She now buys eight gallons, and she has been running her business for 20 years. Kpana sells high quality oil, and because of that, her customers do not buy from other vendors.

Kpana caters to the needs of her family from this little busines Therefore, she needs this loan to purchase a barrel of palm oil, so as to serve her customers in Lakpazee. Kpana hopes to establish a large shop were she can supply other vendors. She dreams of being a successful business woman.

loans.use: To purchase a barrel of palm oil so as to serve customers

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is into the production and sale of palm oil. He is 52 years old and married with seven children. He has been in the business for many years. He is requesting a loan of 120,000 nairas to purchase more palm nut for the production of palm oil to sell. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm nut for production of oil to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells cooked food and drinks to take care of her family's needs and her children's education. She is 43 years old and married with seven children. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuff to cook and sell and drinks as well. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Delphine Abégnonhou

texts.fr: A. Delphine Abégnonhou est née vers 1965 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Delphine est mariée à KOKOYE Calixte. Delphine est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Delphine vit avec ses enfants et supporte les charges de la famille. Delphine vend des condiments de sauces (oignon, tomate, piment, poivre, ail, gingembre, sel, cubes, légumes…), de l'huile rouge de palme, de l'huile d'arachide et du poisson fumé. Delphine est dans cette activité depuis trois ans. C’est au marché Ouando de Porto-Novo que Delphine fait ses achats et vend ses produits de façon ambulante  et à son domicile. Delphine est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux développer son activité, Delphine demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Delphine Agbegnonhou is born around 1965 in Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of the Republic of BENIN. Delphine is married to KOKOYE Calixte. She is the mother of three children, all in school. Delphine lives with her children and takes care of the family expenses. Delphine sells ingredients for sauce ( onions, tomatoes, hot pepper, pepper, garlic, ginger, salt, cubes, vegetables..), palm oil, peanut oil and smoked fish. She's been in this business for three years. She buys in the Ouando market of Porto-Novo and sells her products door-to-door and at her home. Delphine is a customer of ALIDE who repays correctly her loans. In order to grow her business, she is requesting for loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sauce ingredients: onion, tomatoe, hot pepper,pepper, garlic, ginger, salt, cubes, vegatables...

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es: Julia Narda A. Gómez tiene la edad de 59 años. Humildemente se dedica a vender cosméticos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella dio inicio con esfuerzos propios inicio con ciertos productos que le fueron otorgados con muy pocos productos,  ella vive de una manera muy humilde junto a sus 2 hijos y trabaja muy fuertemente por lo que solo así podría proporcionarle sus hijos lo necesario. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas, perfumes, colonias. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es poder relacionarse con otras personas y así obtener más experiencia para con su trabajo. Su mayor sueño es obtener su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Julia Narda A. Gómez is 59. She humbly sells cosmetics. She has been doing this for over ten years because she has always liked to work. She started through her own efforts with certain products; she was given very few products. She lives in a very humble manner with her two children. She works very hard because that is the only way she could give her children the necessities. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy creams, perfumes, and colognes. What she likes best about her work is being able to meet other people and get more work experience. Her biggest dream is to get her own beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hye Woho Den Group

texts.en:
Florence is a hair dresser by profession. She is 25 years old, single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in the town of Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Florence is the leader of a trust bank group called "Hye woho den", meaning "Strengthen Yourself". The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They supply their local market and nearby communities and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Soutoura sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 33, ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à OUAYERMA 1  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt de groupe. Tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
 Elles font entre autres comme activités, la vente de la pomme de terre,  du charbon de bois, de la  brochette de viande, du gingembre, de l’encens etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 sacs de 50 kg de pomme de terre, 20 sacs de charbon de bois, 15 kg de viande pour faire des brochettes, 5 sacs de gingembre et  30 kg de magnokisseni pour la fabrication de l’encens. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes de façon fixe dans les différents marchés de la ville de Sikasso et dans  les quartiers de façon ambulante, la plupart au comptant, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 32.500 FCFA qu’elles comptent utiliser comme épargne, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestie le reste dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres  agrandir leurs activités.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Soutoura group are all married, and are on average 33 years old with 3 children. They live in polygamous households in Ouayerma, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) in order to satisfy the demands of their clientele, and are seeking their fifth group loan. All four of their previous loans were repaid without difficulty. They run businesses that include, among others, the sale of potatoes, charcoal, brochettes of meat, ginger, incense, etc. With their new loan, they intend to buy ten 50-kg sacks of potatoes, 20 bags of charcoal, 15 kg of meat to make brochettes, 5 bags of ginger and 30 kg of "magnokisseni" to make incense. They supply themselves at the grand market in Sikasso city and in the neighbouring villages. They make their sales at stalls in various markets in the city of Sikasso and door-to-door in various areas, mostly in cash, to a clientele composed of men and women. They foresee realizing a monthly profit of 32,500 FCFA each, which they intend to use for savings and to pay for their families' expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in their businesses. Some of the members of this group hope to buy land to live on in Sikasso, and others aim to enlarge their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Yesu Nkoaa Group

texts.en:
Grace is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso, a commercial and farming town in the Western Region of Ghana.

Grace is a trader, dealing in cosmetics. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yesu Nkoaa’, meaning “Only Jesus”. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell or supply in their local market and nearby communities and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Help Yourself Group

texts.en:
Help Yourself is a group of 4 borrowers led by Frances W. T., 38 years old, married with 4 children aged 4-10 years. Frances also  cares for 2 siblings. She‘s a 10th grade drop-out due to poverty.
Frances lives and sells in the Fiamah residence south of the capital Monrovia,Liberia, a very crowded community that lacks both water and electricity because people in that community can’t afford them.

Frances’ business is purchasing charcoal wholesale then sells it retail. She also does tailoring.
She is a good tailor. She does good designs and she has plenty of customers who come to patronize her tailoring business. Frances  sells good charcoal to her neighbors; it encourages them to always want to buy from her.
She has been in business for more than 6 years and is hoping to expand. She is asking for this loan to purchase more charcoal wholesale to acquire more profit, because after purchasing more charcoal and expanding her business, she hopes to realize more profit.
Frances dreams of one day building a nice house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal wholesale to acquire more profit.

loans.name: God's Mercy Group

texts.en: Afia is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Afia is a trader. She trades in cosmetics and local soap production. She is the leader of a trust bank group called God’s Mercy. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 21 years old and single. She has completed the senior high school with good grades that could get her admission to the next level of school. But currently she is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, rice, sugar etc. in the community market where she lives. Vida says these products move very fast and she can easily recover her capital to buy new stock. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With her two years of experience in her business she wants to save more to further her education next year. She dreams of becoming a nurse one day and wants to purchase the forms to process her admission for next year. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tin tomatoes etc. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice spices, yam, plantain and tin tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Yamina Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yamina del Socorro Martínez Murguía es madre luchadora y soltera, tiene 8 hijos 4 de ellos ya mayores de edad y 4 hijos son menores. La señora Yamina es poseedora de un taxi, el cual sale a circular a la ciudad. Por lo que es aquí en donde tiene permiso de operación. Ella ya tiene 10 años con este negocio de taxi,  por lo que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante con sus hijos a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado pues a sus hijos logro ofrecerle todo lo necesario. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días.   El mayor  sueño es llegar a trabajar como propietaria de su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yamina del Socorro Martínez Murguía is a single mother and a go-getter. She has 8 children 4 of which are grown and 4 are still young. Mrs. Yamina owns a taxi, which travels the city, because this is where she has a permit to operate. She has been in this business of driving a taxi for 10 years, she has always been fighting to get her children ahead in spite of the difficulties that have faced her, she has been able to give them all that is necessary. She is very happy with the work that she has since without it she would not be able to provide food every day. Her biggest dream is to be able to work as an owner of her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 20 years old and single. She works very hard to take care of herself. She started doing that when she was only seventeen years old.  She is a baker who has used flour for her production for three years now.  In spite of the challenges she faces, Dorothy bakes bread and retails it to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center and people also take bulk delivery from her. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests a loan support to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can meet the high demand of her customers. She would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 52 years old and a divorced and mother with two children. She has a boy and a girl who are in school. As a single mother she works very hard to provide for her children, especially for their education, shelter, and other expenses. She is a food vendor and she prepares and sells maize porridge in the community where she lives.  Her porridge is enjoyed by many people as breakfast. She prepares and sells it very hot through hawking. She has been in business for the last four years. Gladys requests a loan to buy bags of maize, sugar, cartoons of milk etc. before prices go up. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy maize, sugar, firewood etc.

loans.name: Ebenezer #2 Group

texts.en:
Ebenezer #2 is a group of four borrowers led by Stanley W., 22 years old and a 9th grade student, doesn’t have a family to support him so he decided to start a business to provide for his daily needs and school fees. Stanley buys apples wholesale and sells retail. He lives and sells on Broad Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Stanley has been running this business for two years. He believes looking neat and good makes people wants to buy more apple from him.

Stanley started his business first by selling biscuits, and his capital was 41,000 Liberian dollars borrowed from friends. Stanley’s biggest difficulty is buying apples in United States currency and selling in Liberian dollars. He needs this loan to purchase more apples wholesale to sell so as to expand his business. Stanley is hoping to become a big business person in Liberian society. He dreams of being successful so that he will be able to sustain his family to come.

loans.use: To purchase apples wholesale

loans.name: The Blood Of Jesus Group

texts.en:
Justice is a trader. He runs a cold store in his community. He is 35 years old, married and has four children, all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the town of Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Justice is the leader of a trust bank group called "The Blood of Jesus". The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They supply retailers and chop bar operators in their town and nearby communities. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40 year old trader who sells garment clothes, shoes, slippers and lace materials at the community market center. Lace material is very useful in room and office decoration. Mary treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys few goods because of inadequate funds. She started her business seven years ago.

Mary is married and the mother of five children. Currently all her children attend school in the community where they live. Mary is a very hardworking young woman who strives to sustain her family and her business. For this reason, she requests support to make her business progress. She believes this loan will enable her to grow her business to the desired level. It is her wish to see her children educated to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is a 48-year-old local restaurant operator. She is divorced and has five kids and the one who is her last born is schooling.

Akua prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals she has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves and therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in a food delivering service.

Akua says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditures. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She dreams of building a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making fufu, banku and other local dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 27 years old and is a divorced young woman with two children. Both of her children are in school in the community where they live. Abena is an achiever and her hard work contributes earnestly to the family.

Abena is a food vendor and sells rice and gravy stew by the roadside in the community where she lives. She has been in the business for the last five years in order to support her children. She takes delivery of goods from Dwinase which is a nearby market where she can have access to stock.

Abena says demand for her food is on the high side but she does not have enough money to meet the demand. She requests the loan to buy rice, spices, vegetables, etc. She would grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, bags of rice, etc.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afua started her fresh fish business two years ago in the community where she lives. She runs a mini cold store where she sells fresh fish and chicken. She serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She also runs a farm to earn adequate income to add to her business. She has a large customer base and customers travel from the nearby villages to buy her fish. She takes delivery of fish from Dwinase which is a nearby busy market.

Afua is now 40 years old and is a widowed mother with four children. Currently one child is in school while the rest are working. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish and chicken and also a refrigerator in which to stock her goods. It is her dream to provide a better education for her children and she believes that when she is fully resourced her dream will be fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish and a refrigerator

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
Veronica is sixty years old. She is divorced and has give birth to five children, all now out of school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso, a commercial and farming town in the Western Region of Ghana.

Veronica is a trader, trading in textiles. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Joy and the group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They sell in their local market and nearby communities and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 23-year-old married young woman with one child who is breastfeeding. Janet is an achiever and her hard work contributes earnestly to her family.

Janet is a food vendor and sells rice and gravy stew by the roadside in the community where she lives. She takes delivery of raw materials from Dwinase, which is a nearby market where she has access to stock. She has been in the business for the last two years, supporting the husband in taking care of the home.

Janet says demand for her food is on the high side but she does not have enough money to meet the demand. She requests the loan to buy rice, spices, vegetables, etc. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables and bags of rice

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 23-year-old married young woman with one child who is breastfeeding. Janet is an achiever and her hard work contributes earnestly to her family.

Janet is a food vendor and sells rice and gravy stew by the roadside in the community where she lives. She takes delivery of raw materials from Dwinase, which is a nearby market where she has access to stock. She has been in the business for the last two years, supporting the husband in taking care of the home.

Janet says demand for her food is on the high side but she does not have enough money to meet the demand. She requests the loan to buy rice, spices, vegetables, etc. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables and bags of rice

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha B. es madre de familia, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 1 hija de diez años de edad que asiste al colegio. El negocio que se dedica a esta señora es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio por cuenta propia por lo que trabaja con su esposo, quien es el encargado de abastecer la mercadería, para ello él viaja frecuentemente a la ciudad donde compra las prendas a menores precios. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares es una mujer que le gusta trabajar. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y tallas extra grande que es lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El deseo de Martha es establecer su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Martha B. is 40 years old. She has a 10 year old daughter who is currently attending secondary school.

Martha sells clothing in various locations. She opened her business alone, but now now works with her husband who purchases the clothing wholesale. He goes into the city of Leon to buy at the lowest prices. Martha enjoys getting to know new places through her work and working hard

Martha is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of more shirts, pants, skirts, and the extra large sizes that her clients want. Martha's goal is to establish her own store.


Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace started her fish business five years ago, selling in the community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty fish in the market and, for that reason, she is one among the many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from her in the market place, so she has added food ingredients to her stock, which are frequently demanded by her customers.

Grace is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children. All her children are currently in school except her last born, who is breastfeeding. She supports her children from the proceeds of her business. She depends on this income for their food, school bills and, sometimes, medical bills. She has requested this loan to buy more assorted fish, to increase her sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy started her fish business three years ago in the community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty fish in the market and, for that reason, she is one among the many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from her in the market place.

Mercy is 36 years old, married and a mother with six children. Five of her children are currently in school and her last child is breastfeeding. She supports her children from her business proceeds with the help of her husband. She depends on this income for their food, school bills and, sometimes, medical bills. She has requested this loan to buy more assorted fish to increase her sales and income, to support her children's education and business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia has been a local manufacturer of soaps for 40 years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to make her soaps. In addition, she sells kenkey that she prepares by herself for her customers. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to lack of funds.

Afia is 60 years old, married and the mother of ten children. She lives with her husband and her last born whom she is taking care of through school. She works very hard as a mother to help her husband, who is working as a farmer, to take care of the family. She wants to take advantage of this loan opportunity to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to increase her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to her children and she believes that her dream can come true.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, coconut oil and other foodstuffs, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: T. Alice est née vers 1979 à Zanzounmè. Alice est mariée à METONOU Adrien. Alice est mère de quatre enfants mais en plus de ses enfants, elle a deux autres enfants à charge. La famille vit à Missérété dans la commune de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN.  Alice vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. C’est depuis cinq ans que Alice vend le maïs et les divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). C’est au marché Ouando qu’Alice fait ses provisions et vend ses produits chez elle à la maison. Alice est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux développer son activité, Alice demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Alice T. was born around 1979 in the town of Zanzounme. Alice is married to Adrien Metonou. Alice is the mother of four children, but in addition to her own children she has two others in her care. The family lives in Misserete in the community of Porto-Novo, the capital city of Benin. Alice is able to help her husband in the support of their family thanks to her business. For the past five years Alice has sold corn and various other items (candies, cookies, bottled milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pastas, as well as laundry, dish, and personal soaps, batteries, candles etc.). In the Ouando market Alice buys her supplies but she sells her products from her home. Alice is a client of Alide (Kiva Field Partner), and she has always repaid her loans successfully. In order to expand her business, Alice requests a loan that will be used as working capital.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn and various other products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 30 years old and is a divorced mother with four kids who are in school. She has been a food vendor for four years now. She prepares and sells beans and gari (roasted cassava) with ripe plantain. She serves a large number of customers. Ripe plantain with beans, as we call it, is a delicacy that many Ghanaians enjoy everyday either as breakfast or lunch.

Adwoa’s business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, grains, oil, vegetables, plantains and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family’s well being. She would be very grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of grains, beans, gari, vegetables, ripe plantains and assorted meat

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of five children, all of whom are currently in school in the community where they live.

Esther is a food vendor and sells banku with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Esther has many customers since banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Esther wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise an increased income to support her business and to include the sale of cereals in bags to her customers. She saves some of her earnings as an investment for the future.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making banku

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of a child who is breastfeeding. Victoria owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc., in the area where she lives. 

She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. With her two years of trading experience and with Christmas approaching, she needs more capital to buy goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more to complete the project she is embarking upon. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 31 years old, married and the mother with no children. She had a child but died when she was a kid and since then she is been expecting one but has been very difficult for her to conceive. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of assorted fishes and chicken and a refrigerator to stock her goods. 

She started her fresh fish business two years ago in the community where she lives. She serves her customers with very tasty and good quality  of fish and frozen chicken and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She runs a mini cold store where she sells fresh fish and chicken. She has a high customer base; some of her customers travel from the nearby villages to buy her fish. She takes delivery of fish from Dwinase, which is a nearby busy market. 

It is her dream to be a larger supplier of frozen food in the community and its environs. She has a strong belief that when she is fully resourced, her dream will be fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fresh fish and a refrigerator

loans.name: Mindo Jeanne

texts.fr: T. Mindo Jeanne est née vers 1958 à Missérété. Jeanne est mariée à AYIDOKINHOU David. Le couple a six enfants à charge dont cinq les leurs. Jeanne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. En effet, Jeanne achète et vend des bouteilles vides qu’elle collecte de ménage en ménage. C’est depuis quinze ans que Jeanne est dans cette activité. Jeanne est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Jeanne demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Jeanne Mindo T. was born around 1958 in the town of Misserete. Jeanne is married to David Ayidokinhou. The couple have six children in their care, five are their own. Jeanne is able to help her husband support the family thanks to the income from her business. Jeanne buys and sells empty bottles that she collects from business to busienss. Jeanne has been managing this business for the past 15 years. Jeanne is a client of Alide (Kiva Field Partner), and she has always managed to repay her loans. In order to better provide to her clientele, Jeanne requires a loan, which will be used as capital funds.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase empty bottles.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama M. est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires comme du miel et de l’huile de palme. Elle s’active aussi dans d’autres activités comme la restauration et la transformation de fruits en jus concentré. Son objectif est d’augmenter les revenus familiaux.
texts.en:
Mariama M. is 36 years old, she is married and she is the mother of 8 children. She sells food products such as honey and palm oil. She is also active in other business types, such as the sales of fruit juices from concentrate. Her goal is to increase the family income.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
Yaa is 37 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. 

Yaa is a baker. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Justice. The group members are engaged in either farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Mayra Elena

texts.es: La señora Mayra Elena R. M. tiene 42 años de edad madre de familia tiene dos hijos que van al colegio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que ella es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar por lo que en la actualidad sigue con el mismo negocio ya que tiene que proporcionar el alimento diario de su familia. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosméticos, calzado y bolsos.  En su deseo esta el salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra Elena is 42 years old and a mother of two children who attend school. She sells general merchandise. For over 7 years she has dedicated herself to this business. Mayra is a woman who has always liked to work and she continues by means of this business to feed her family.

Mayra is soliciting financing to invest in her business, for buying clothes, cosmetics, shoes and purses. Among her desires is getting ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: El Abed R

texts.fr: El Abed R D. est une femme de 47ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de vaisselle et de tissu. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
El Abed R. D. is a 47 year-old woman, she is married and she is the mother of 3 children. She sells kitchen utensils as well as linen. This loan will improve her business and in consequence the living conditions of her family will also be improved.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old and she is married and the mother of eight children. She is currently taking care of three while the rest are fully independent. Among the three, two are in school. She always works hard to meet her target, and through that she has acquired lots of marketing and selling experience.

Mary is a trader and sells vegetables and spices like cabbage, tomatoes, onions, pepper, etc., on a table in the community market. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. She is requesting the loan to buy lots of cabbage, carrots, tomatoes, onions, spices, etc. to upgrade her stock. She dreams of saving more to take care of her children’s educational needs.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices like carrots, tomatoes, onions, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.en:
Rose sells pastries. She is 59 years old, married and has five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment the town of Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Rose is the leader of a trust bank group called Bethel. The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They supply their local market and nearby communities, and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: El señor Adán M. vive con su esposa la señora Alicia Campechano, tienen un hijo de edad escolar, por el cual están luchando día a día para salir adelante, el trabaja en una empresa donde vende y reparte agua purificada desde hace 3 años, su esposa labora para una fabrica en el área de operador con una antigüedad de 2 años, son una familia muy estable y trabajadora, ellos tienen su casita para la cual tienen varios proyectos, el principal de ellos es la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda para mayor protección de la familia; motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Adán M. lives with his wife Mrs. Alicia Campechano. They work hard each day so they can provide a good life for their son. Mr. Adán has worked for a company for three years selling and distributing purified water. His wife has worked at a local factory for two years. They are a hard working and stable family. They are also homeowners hoping to complete several home improvement projects. They particularly want to build a wall behind their house for more security, which is why they are soliciting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall behind their home.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: T. Célestine est née vers 1976 à Hanzoumè. Célestine est mariée à GOUSSIKINDE Michel. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Missérité à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN.  Ensemble, Célestine et son mari supportent les charges de la famille. En effet, Célestine vend des vêtements pour enfants de façon ambulante. Célestine est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Célestine demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Celestine T. was born around 1976 in the town of Hanzoume. Celestine is married to Michel Goussikinde. The couple has five children, all in school. The family lives in the district of Misserite in Porto-Novo, the capital city of Benin. Together, Celestine and her husband cover the family's expenses. Celestine sells children's clothing from door to door. Celestine is a client of Alide (Kiva Field Partner), and she has always managed to repay her loans. So that she may better satisfy customer demands, Celestine requires a loan, to be used as working capital.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Zion Group

texts.en: Doris is a 35-year-old married mother of four children who all attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Doris is a trader of dried fish. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Zion. The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They sell in their local market and nearby communities, and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy dried fish in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Awurade Nim Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old divorced mother of four children who all attend school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Mary is a trader in crates of eggs, she takes delivery of eggs in the farming communities in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She sell in the local market and nearby communities, and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. She want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Awurade Nim’ which literary means God knows. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. The group would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: L. Bernadette est née vers 1978 à Hanzounmè à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Bernadette est mariée à METONNOU Bathélémy. Le couple a quatre enfants. La famille vit à Akpro-missérité. Bernadette a fait le cours primaire. C’est ensemble avec son mari que Bernadette assure les charges de la famille. Bernadette fait la couture ; mais principalement, Bernadette coût  les vêtements et les met en vente. Bernadette a déjà douze ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Bernadette est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Bernadette demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Bernadette L. was born around 1978 in the district of Hanzounme in Porto-Novo, the capital city of Benin. Bernadette is married to Bathelemy Metonnou. The couple has four children and they live in the town of Akpro-Misserite. Bernadette completed primary school. Together with her husband, Bernadette covers the family expenses. Bernadette is a hair stylist, but mostly, she makes and sells clothing. Bernadette has gathered 12 years' experience in this occupation. Bernadette is a client of Alide (Kiva Field Partner) and she has always managed to repay her loans. In order to meet customer demands, Bernadette requires a loan, to be used as working capital.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, to make clothing.

loans.name: Yèmè

texts.fr: A. Yèmè est née vers 1972 à Zoungbomè. Yèmè est mariée à Dah SOUNLI Jérémie. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont encore à leurs charges. La famille vit à Zoungbomè. C’est ensemble avec son mari que Yèmè assure les charges de la famille. C’est les noix de palme que Yèmè transforme en huile rouge. Yèmè vend aussi à manger mais de façon ambulante. Yèmè est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Yèmè demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Yeme A. was born around 1972 in the town of Zoungbome. Yeme is married to Jeremie Dah Sounli. The couple have two children who are still in their care. The family lives in Zoungbome. It is together with her husband that Yeme is able to provide for the needs of her family. Yeme makes red palm oil from coconut seeds. Yeme also sells ready to eat corn door to door. Yeme is a client of Alide (Kiva Field Partner), and she has always managed to repay her loans. So that she might meed customer demands, Yeme requires a loan, to be used as working capital.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coconut seeds.

loans.name: Marianela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marianela del Carmen V. M. es una joven de 18 años de edad, quien vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos en una comunidad llamada San Francisco de la Palmera, localizada en  San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo, ya que  a través de las actividades agrícolas es que ha logrado desarrollar actividades conexas y de servicios en la comunidad, tales como el ganado de engorde y la oportunidad de pequeños comercios y microempresas entre otros.

Hace poco Marianela tuvo que dejar sus estudios ya que no tenía suficiente ayuda económica para seguir, pero comenta que tuvo la idea de iniciar su propio proyecto,gracias al apoyo se su familia, su esfuerzo y perseverancia fue como empezó a dedicarse a la avicultura; poco a poco ha podido crear un  lugar  en el patio de su casa en donde cría pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras y así poder venderlos a sus vecinos en la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.
