Actualmente Marianela está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢300,000 (trescientos  mil colones) para la compra de más pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras, además de compra de concentrado para su alimentación y productos para la prevención y  tratamiento de enfermedades, además de ampliar y reforzar su local. 

Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a más clientes y ofrecerles un mejor servicio. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y así poder seguir adelante con sus estudios y poder cumplir sus metas.

Marianela es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Francisco de la Palmera, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Marianela del Carmen V. M. is a young woman of 18. She lives with her parents and two brothers in an area called San Francisco de la Palmera which is located in San Carlos in the province of Alajuela. This rural community has a lot of potential for development because in addition to agricultural work they have been able to develop community services like fattening cattle and small businesses opportunities. Marianela had to drop out of school a short while ago for economic reasons, but says that would like to start her own business thanks to the help she is receiving from her family. Her efforts and perseverance are what helped her get into aviculture. Bit by bit, she has been able to create a space on her patio to raise chickens and laying hens to sell to her neighbors, who are very happy with the quality. Today, Marianela is asking for a micro-loan of 300,000 colons to purchase more chickens and hens. She would also like to buy animal feed and products to prevent and treat illnesses and expand her space. Marianela would like to grow her business with this loan, be able to take care of her customers, and provide better service. All of this will help her improve her living conditions and in this way she will be able to continue her education and achieve her goals. Marianela is a member of the communal bank “San Francisco de la Palmera” which is one of hundreds of EDESA’s member institutions in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes s to grow both personally and economically as well as participate actively in her community and communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, hens, and supplies

loans.name: Oussou Richard

texts.fr: F. Oussou Richard est né vers 1960 à Ayokpo. Oussou Richard est marié et père de treize enfants. Mais Oussou Richard a seulement six enfants à charge aujourd’hui. Oussou Richard assure les charges de la famille mais avec l’aide de sa femme. Oussou Richard est un pêcheur. Oussou Richard a déjà vingt ans d’expérience dans la pêche. Oussou Richard veut augmenter sa capacité en matière de pêche et pour cela il a besoin de moyens financiers. C’est la raison pour laquelle Oussou Richard sollicite un prêt d’ALIDé pour acheter le matériel nécessaire.
texts.en:
Oussou Richard F. was born around 1960 in the town of Ayokpo. Oussou Richard is married and he is the father of 13 chidlren, but only six of his children are still in his care. Oussou Richard provides for the needs of the family together with his wife. Oussou Richard is a fisherman. Oussou Richard has been carrying out his fishing business for the past 20 years. Oussou Richard wants to increase the size of his catch and for this he requires financial support. For this reason Oussou Richard is requesting a loan from Alide (Kiva Field Partner). He will purchase all the tools necessary.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana tiene 59 años, vive con el menor D. sus hijos, D. 14 años, en su casa propia. DesD. hace 25 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, para tal fin es poyada por sus hijos mayores, quienes vienen a su chacra en cada campaña D. siembra; para que todos, uniendo fuerzas, logren sembrar grandes extensiones D. terreno. Cuando llega la época D. la cosecha, D. igual manera se reúnen para recoger la abundante cantidad D. productos, generalmente: papa y maíz. Posteriormente, éstos son vendidos en las principales ferias D. su localidad, por ello Adriana siempre está pendiente D. los precios del maíz, el trigo y la papa, pues según esto sus ganancias serán D. mayor provecho a toda la familia. 
Esta es la tercera oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP, obtener estos créditos le han enseñado a ser más responsable con sus cuentas y ahora mucho más cumplirá con puntualidad el pago D. esta cuotas. El dinero solicitado será utilizado en la compra sacos D. abono y en el pago del alquiler D. un tractor para su próxima siembra D. maíz.
texts.en:
Adriana is 59 years old. She lives with the youngest of her children, age 14, in her own house. She has been farming for 25 years. Through this work she supported her older children, who come to her farm each planting season. With them all joining forces they succeed in planting large tracts of land. Similarly, when the harvest season arrives they meet in order to collect an abundant quantity of crops, usually potatoes and corn. Afterwards, these are sold in the principal markets in her area. That’s why Adriana is always paying attention to the prices of corn, wheat, and potatoes—because according to this her earnings will be of greater benefit to her entire family.

This is the third opportunity she has for a loan with MFP. Obtaining these loans has taught her to be more responsible with her accounts and now she is sure to make her payments with punctuality. The money applied for will be used for purchasing sacks of fertilizer and for rental payments for a tractor for her next planting of corn.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and rental payments for a tractor for planting crops

loans.name: Edicely

texts.es:
Edicely tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de refrescos en una de las calles principales de su ciudad. Sus herramientas de trabajo son: un balde, un cucharón y vasos, al inicio de su negocio no contaba con un lugar fijo de ventas y caminaba largas horas por diferentes lugares de su localidad. Pero ahora ya tiene una zona donde ofrece diariamente deliciosos refrescos y debido a la calidad de sus bebidas, Edicely ha adquirido clientes regulares, por quienes se anima a seguir mejorando en su negocio.
Esta es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy activa en su banco comunal y lo que la caracteriza es la puntualidad en el cumplimiento de sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de una carreta de ventas y un balde nuevo para seguir vendiendo sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Edicely is 26 years old and lives with her husband and 4 kids in their own house. Since she was 12 she's been selling refreshments at one of her town's main street for a living. Her work tools are: a bucket, a ladle, and glasses. At the beginning of her business, she didn't have a fixed place and used to walk for hours around her community seeling her beverages. Now she has a specific spot where she offers her delicious refreshments every day, and because the quality is so good, she has gained some regular clients, which brings her the enthusiasm to keep improving her business. This is the 5th time she takes a loan from MFP and she is very punctual in making the payments. The loan she's asking will be used to buy a beverage selling cart and a new bucket so she can keep selling her refreshments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a beverage selling cart and other tools for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 20 años y desde niño vio y aprendió de su padre la elaboración de bellos trajes típicos de su región a base de diversas aplicaciones (mostacillas, lentejuelas) y bordados únicos. Hoy, este oficio le sirve para ser independiente, pues desde hace 2 años viene elaborando estos trajes para las fiestas populares de los pueblos aledaños de su zona y en algunas ocasiones trabaja con su padre para elaborar trabajos especiales. La clave de su negocio está en su creatividad y en los bonitos diseños que crea, pues así tiene la opción de poner un precio a sus prendas que cubran su inversión y horas de trabajo.
Es la tercera oportunidad que solicita un crédito con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de seguir  trabajando por el fortalecimiento de su grupo. El dinero que ahora requiere será invertido en la compra de materiales textiles, como hilos y telas de diversos colores y texturas.
texts.en:
Elvis is 20 years old. Since he was a child he saw and learned from his father how to make beautiful clothing typical of his region. He used different embellishments (beads, sequins) and unique embroidery. Today this trade has made him independent. For two years he has been making these clothes for festivals that are popular in the towns in the outskirts of his region. Sometimes he works with his father on special jobs. The key to his business is his creativity and the beautiful designs that he creates. This way he has the option of putting a price on his clothes that cover his investment and his hours of work. This is his third opportunity to ask for a loan with MFP. He has a great desire to keep working to strengthen his group. The money that he now needs is to buy textile materials like thread and different colors and textures of fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy textile materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica al bordados D. prendas típicas D. su zona, que son fustanes (faldas) muy utilizados en las festividades regionales. Adicionalmente, por las mañanas, venD. verduras D. manera ambulante y cuando regresa a su casa se dedica a realizar sus bellos bordados. Una D. sus hijas es quien L. apoya en estas tareas y juntas producen prendas muy coloridas y del  agrado D. sus clientes. Margarita se ha hecho conocida en este ámbito y siempre vienen a solicitarle fustanes, por lo que su deseo es incrementar su producción.
Esta es L. primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, elL. fue recomendada para formar parte  D. un banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita será utilizado en L. compra D. hilos y telas, así como para invertir en su negocio D. venta D. verduras para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She makes embroidered garments typical of her region, which are skirts used in the regional festivities. Additionally, during the mornings, she sells vegetables via a mobile market, and when she returns home, she makes her beautiful embroideries. One of her daughters helps her with this work, and together they make very colorful garments that her customers like a lot.

Margarita has become well known in this field, and people always come to request her skirts, so therefore her wish is to increase her production. This is the first time she has a loan with MFP. She was recommended to form part of a community bank, so therefore she is committed to be punctual with her payments. The money that she is requesting will be used for the purchase of thread and fabric, as well as to invest in her business selling vegetables to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textile materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma V. A. es una señora de 60 años de edad, quien vive con su madre en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Cuatro Bocas de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura.

Desde hace bastante tiempo doña Vilma  está al cuidado de su madre, dice que cuando era más joven ella podía ir a trabajar fuera de su casa, pero con el paso de los años la salud de su madre se ha ido deteriorando lo que hizo que doña Vilma dejara su trabajo. Pero ella siempre ha sido muy esforzada  y retomó un proyecto que tenía en años anteriores. Ahora doña Vilma se dedica a la plantación de Teca, es un árbol frondoso el cual tiene la capacidad de no dañarse cuando entra en contacto con metales, su madera es muy resistente al agua, lo que lo hace muy valioso para la fabricación de muebles y embarcaciones.

En estos momentos doña Vilma desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢650,000 (seiscientos cincuenta  mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su plantación así también comprar fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos necesarios para mantenerle en buen estado.

Doña Vilma es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bansuperafe; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer   préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Vilma V. A. is 60 years old, and lives with her mother in a small rural community in Costa Rica called Cuatro Bocas de Upala, in the province of Alajuela. There they are developing many activities such as trade, stockbreeding for two purposes (meat and milk), and agriculture.

For quite some time, Vilma has been taking care of her mother. She says that when she was younger, she could go to work outside of the house, but with the passing of the years, her mother´s health has been deteriorating, which made Vilma leave her job. But she has always worked very hard, and she has taken back up a project that she had years before. Now Vilma works in the Teca plantation. Teca is a lush tree that has the capacity to not be damaged when it comes into contact with metals. Its wood is very resistant to water, which makes it very valuable for making furniture and boats.

Now Vilma wants to obtain a loan for 650 colons, in order to do maintenance in her plantation, and also to buy fertilizers, and to pay for other necessary inputs to keep it in a good state.

Vilma is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bansuperafe; which is only made up of women, and specializes in supporting non-professional women and female heads of households. It is one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan, and with it, she hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level, as well as actively participate in the loan organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and purchase of inputs for the teca plantation

loans.name: Lucy Margarita

texts.en: Lucy is a member of the Sun and Moon Village Bank.  She is 55 years old and married with six children over age 18.  Lucy is a seamstress. She began working when she was 17 years old.  After she studied sewing she began working from her house. The last few years, her business has dropped because people do not want sewn things anymore. Since 2002, Lucy has run a taxi service with her husband.  They have two cars that her husband and son use as taxis.  Lucy has been with FINCA for 7 years. With the loans, she has been able to purchase their two cars. Lucy needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she is going to use to repair the two cars. Her dream is to buy another car so that another of her sons can work in the family business as well.

loans.use: To repair the two taxis.

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: Jeaneth esta solicitando su 3er crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo compra de materiales de construcciòn y mejorar algunos detalles que le hacen falta a su casa, trabaja en la colonia la Fonseca a 34 km de Nueva Guinea, esta profesora todos los dias tiene que madrugar para dejar hechos sus quehaceres  para a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de esa colonia,  a pesar que ella no tiene hijos le ayuda a su mamà con los gastos familiares,  son una familia muy unida, que ha luchado para ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda  su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo,  salud y llegar a ser una excelente profesional,  esta clienta tiene como meta el proximo año estudiar una licenciatura para asi mejorar mas sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is requesting her third loan with AFODENIC to invest in the purchase of construction materials, and to improve some details that are missing in her house. She works in the district Fonseca, 34km from Nueva Guinea. Every day, this teacher has to get up early in order to finish her chores so she can share the gift of education with the children in the neighborhood.

Since she does not have children, she helps her mother with the family expenses. They are a very close-knit family, which has struggled to improve their home little by little. Her dream is to finish building her home to be more comfortable, and to have work, and health, and to become an excellent professional. She has a goal for next year to study a degree to improve her knowledge.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel es soltero,  vive en la zona # 4 en Nueva Guinea, trabaja como cajero del PALI de esta ciudad desde hace 2 años, esta solicitando su primer  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo  en la construccion de un cuarto en la casa de su mamá que es donde habita, y de esta manera poder tener mayor comodidad y privacidad, en su comunidad es conocido como un joven responsable, trabajador  que a pesar que no tiene hijos ayuda a su mamà con los gastos familiares,en su centro de trabajo y su barrio es  muy querido  por ser una persona de buen vivir y muy alegre, su sueño es seguir estudiando y que su familia siempre permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel is unmarried and lives in Zone 4 in Nueva Guinea (New Guinea), Nicaragua. He has been working as a cashier in his town’s PALI (supermarket chain) for 2 years. He is asking for his first loan from AFODENIC to invest in the construction of a room in his mother’s house where he lives so that he can be more comfortable and have greater privacy. He is known as a responsible young man in his community. Despite not having any children, he works to help his mother with the household expenses. Both in his place of work and his neighbourhood he is treasured as a lively and happy person. His dream is to continue his studies and that his family will always stay together.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room in his mother's house

loans.name: Marisella Del Carmen

texts.es: Marisella es soltera, trabaja en la colonia Providencia a 34 km de Nueva Guinea como enfermera, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo compra de materiales de construcciòn para repellar y hecharle el piso que le hacen falta a su habitaciòn, todos los dias tiene que madrugar para dejar hechos sus quehaceres del hogar y viajar en el camiòn que sale a las 5 de la mañana para estar  a las 8 en punto en su trabajo,  a pesar que no tiene hijos le ayuda a su mamà con los gastos familiares, ya que  son una familia muy unida, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, contar con trabajo,  salud y  seguir estudiando  para llegar a ser una excelente profesional,  tiene como meta el proximo año estudiar una licenciatura para asi mejorar mas sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Marisella is single. She works as a nurse in the zone Providencia, 34 km from Nueva Guinea. She is requesting her second loan with AFODENIC to invest in the purchase of building material to repair and build the floor of her room. She gets up very early every day to do her chores and then commute by bus at 5:00 am to her work which starts at 8:am. Even if she does not have any children she helps her mother with the family expenses as they are very united. It is her dream to build her own house to be more comfortable, to have work, health and to continue her studies to become an excellent professional. It is her goal for next year to study a bachelor's degree in order to increase her knowledge.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a room and build the floor

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Gómez tiene 44 años de edad. Es madre soltera y junto a sus 3 hijos ha luchado para salir adelante. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que labora con esta actividad, por lo que es importante para ella. Ya que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, hace buenas relaciones y eso la ayuda a incrementar su lista de clientes, de esa manera sigue incrementando sus ventas. El financiamiento que solicita es parar capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, refrescos, gaseosas, detergentes entre otras cosas. En un futuro le gustaría tener su propia distribuidora para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Gómex is 44 years old. She is a single mother and together with her 3 children she has struggled to get ahead. For more than 5 years she has worked at a general store which represents her economical activity and therefore is very important to her. She likes her work as she meets many people, establish good relationships, and this helps to increase the number of customers as well as sales. The loan requested will be used as work capital to buy candy, pops, soft drinks, detergent, etc. In the future she would like to own a distributor's company in order to supply her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Sugeydi Pascuala

texts.es: Sugeydi Pascuala vive en la comarca  Paraiso de Aguas Sarcas de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como maestra de primaria en esta comunidad, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una  habitación y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, con el crédito anterior solo logro comprar materiales de construcciòn y ahora desea cumplir su sueño de construir, esta joven se ha caracterizado por ser una docente  muy responsable, honesta, ha demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia,  su esposa trabaja como docente  en la misma comarca donde ellos viven,  son una familia de escasos recursos econòmicos que han luchado para seguir  adelante y para seguir estudiando , actualmente  esta estudiando su ultimo año de magisterio.  Sugeydi sueña con tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, seguir estudiando y salud para su familia.
texts.en:
Sugeydi Pascuala lives in the region Paraiso de Aguas Sarcas of Nueva Guinea. She works as an elementary school teacher in this community. She is requesting her second loan with the institution AFODENIC, to build a room and thus improve the conditions of her home. With the previous loan she bought the building material and now she wants to fulfill her dream and build. This young lady is a very responsible and honest teacher, she has shown good conduct and credit moral. Her husband works as a teacher in the same region where they live. They are a family of limited economic resources who have struggled to get ahead and continue studying. At the moment she is studying her last year to become a certified teacher. Sugeydi dreams of having a more comfortable home, work stability, of continuing to study and health for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda trabaja como docente desde hace 12 años en una escuela de Nueva Guinea, tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad las cuales tambien se desempeñan como docente, esta solicitando su 8vo credito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en construcciòn de  una habitación y asi tener privacidad y comodidad,  pues actualmente comparte el cuarto con la hija menor y esta pronto a casarse y desea que cuente con las mejores condiciones, a pesar que  esta familia es de escasos recursos económicos se caracterizan por ser muy responsables, Yolanda a demostrado ser una docente  que  ama  su trabajo  su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita para su familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda has been working as a teacher for 12 years at a school in Nueva Guinea. She has 2 adult daughters who are also teachers. She is requesting her eighth loan with AFODENIC to invest in building a room to obtain privacy and comfort, as she is presently sharing the room with her youngest daughter. She will soon marry and wishes to have better living conditions. Even if her family is of limited economic resources they are very responsible. Yolanda has proven to be a teacher who loves her work. It is her dream to have health, work and a nice dwelling for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Adolfo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Adolfo Antonio D. Q. tiene 29 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y compra de ganado. El negocio consiste en comprar y vender ganado, el realiza sus compras en comunidades por lo que es aquí donde le resulta mucho más favorable para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Los financiamientos siempre han sido utilizados para invertirlos en su negocio. Sus inicios se dan por su Papa quien le enseño este oficio y cuando tenía la edad de 7 años le regalo un ternero y así poco a poco fue logrando comprar vacas, toros y ternero y tener su propio negocio. La situación más difícil es que no tenía suficiente animales para ofrecer pero con loa financiamientos salió adelante. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de más ganado. su deseo es expandir su negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mr. Adolfo Antonio D. Q. is 29-years-old. His business consists of buying and selling livestock. He makes his purchases in communities because it is here where he will be the most successful in providing for his family. Funding has always been used to invest in his business. He got his start when his father taught him this trade when he was 7-years-old and gave him a calf. Bit by bit Antonio managed to buy cows, bulls, and calves and to have his own business. The most difficult part is that he didn’t have enough animals but with the financing he was able to move forward. He is currently seeking more funding so he can purchase more livestock. He desires to expand his business so he can be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en su casa propia. Él proviene de una zona rural donde se dedican a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, pero cada fin de semana viaja a la ciudad para vender su ganado vacuno y ovino, los cuales vende en la feria ganadera que se realiza todos los domingos. Su hermana es quien más lo apoya en estas actividades, siendo la venta de animales lo que le proporciona mayores ganancias en comparación de sus productos agrícolas y esto anima a Noe a tener más capital en ganado.
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y uno de los factores que influyeron en la calificación de su préstamo es que es conocido en su zona como una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. El dinero que solicita será utilizado en la compra de varios toretes para engordarlos y venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Noe is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his children. He comes from a rural area where he is a farmer and a livestock farmer, but each weekend he travels to the city to sell his cattle and sheep, which he sells in the livestock fair that takes place every Sunday. It is his sister who supports him the most in his business, feeling that animal sales provides him with higher profits compared to his agricultural products, and this encourages Noe to have more livestock capital. This is the first time he has had a loan with MFP, and one of the factors that influenced the qualification of his loan is that he is known in his area as a respectable and hard-working person. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase young bulls to fatten them and sell them at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulls

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 5 años tiene una tienda de productos comestibles, donde vende todos los días con una atención muy esmerada en sus clientes. En algunas oportunidades su madre la apoya con las ventas cuando Sofía tiene que salir. Y debido al buen trato y a los precios cómodos que ofrece ha notado el incremento de su clientela, es por eso que para el futuro desea seguir implementando su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.
Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y el dinero que solicita en esta oportunidad será invertido en la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Sofía is 33 years old, and lives with her partner in a rented house. For 5 years she has had a grocery store, where she sells every day with very careful attention to her customers. At times, her mother helps her with the store when Sofia is not able to be there. Because of the good deals and low prices that she offers, she has noticed growth in her clientele. For this reason she wishes to continue improving her store and offering a greater variety of products. This is her 5th loan with MFP and the money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patuju Group

texts.es: El grupo “Patuju” están representadas por la señora Ana Rosario y conformada por 17 miembros que van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como ropa, cotillones, pan, cosméticos, comida, dulces y al servicio domestico, albañiles, cocineros, atención de cafés Internet y a la realización de telares. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desde su primer ciclo recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios y al incremento de su mercadería para ofrecer al mercado un producto de mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas de las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinde a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Patuju group is represented by Mrs. Ana Rosario and made up of 17 members who are in their second cycle with the institution and who demonstrate responsibility, honesty and the desire to succeed to continue growing with the economic support that the institution gives them. The majority of the members dedicate themselves to the sale of products like clothing, party novelties, bread, cosmetics, food, sweets and articles for the home such as masons, cookery, products for internet cafes and the for construction of looms. The effort that this group has exhibited since their first cycle has begun to take off because of the new credit requirement which is to work to grow their business and increase their stock of merchandise to be able to provide a more competitive and higher quality product to the market. The members' expectations are to have a productive business that will give their families a higher quality of life and give their children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the group coordinator of the group Dios es Amor (God is Love).  Her story is representative of the living conditions and businesses of her colleagues. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best.  Juana makes her home here in a simple structure made of concrete blocks with a tin roof with her husband and child.

"Would you like to purchase some clothing? While you look, why not have some ice cream to cool you down?" To paraphrase a bit, this would be the sales pitch that one might expect to hear from Juana. She recognized demand for these items in her local community and successfully established her business.  After having successfully repaid her first loan, Juana is taking another loan to purchase more clothing, hair accessories, and ice cream to sell to her clients.  She plans to use the additional profits to finish her home and also to purchase school supplies for her children. In the long term she dreams of sending her child to the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more products for resale.

loans.name: Nuevo Milenio Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Milenio” es un grupo compuesto por 13 socias que se dedican a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, Abarrotes, dulces, CDs, y variedad D. productos que les generen ingresos para poder sustentar a sus familias, este grupo ya esta trabajando con L. institución bajo esta modalidad D. crédito por cuarto ciclos, tiempo en el que han demostrado responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. trabajar. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe L. competencia D. L. oferta y L. demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para L. diversificación D. productos y para invertir en L. compra D. materiales insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar L. calidad D. sus productos parque estos puedan combatir a L. competencia Las socias van cursando su cuarto ciclo dentro D. L. institución por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como administrar los fondos, es por esta razón que L. fundación les brinda un apoyo económico para que puedan sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The New Millennium Group is composed of 13 members dedicated to the sale of beauty products, groceries, sweets, CDs, and a variety of products that generate income to sustain their families. This group has already worked with their micro-finance organization through four loans, during which time they have demonstrated responsibility, honesty and a willingness to work. In every type of commerce the competition of supply and demand always exists, and the members know how to forge ahead to proviD. a better quality of life for their families.

This loan is destined for diversification of products, and to invest in supplies and tools that will improve the quality of their products and help them keep up with the competition.

The fact that the members are in their fourth loan cycle with their institution is because they can count on experience in solidarity groups and they know how to administer funds. This is why the foundation offers its economic help, so they and their families can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR OPERATING CAPITAL FOR A VARIETY OF BUSINESSES

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Rubi" están representadas por Lesly Miriam y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades algunas venden ropa, otras son promotoras D. cosméticos, otras costuran prendas D. vestir y confeccionan trajes. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en la compra D. telas al por mayor, mercadería acorD. a la época e insumos para elaborar mas y mejores productos. A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo algunas D. las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar adecuadamente los fondos que se les otorga y conocen a cabalidad la responsabilidad que se requiere para seguir creciendo con el apoyo D. la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The members of the Rubi Community Bank are represented by Lesly Miriam and make up a group of 12 members who are dedicated to different professional endeavors. Some sell clothing, others sell cosmetics, others sew clothing and costumes. As in any commercial business, there always exists competition and the demand, but these members know how to succeed to be able to obtain more income to be able to give their families a better quality of life. This loan is for product diversification and for investment in the purchase of wholesale materials according to the time and input to be able to make more and higher quality products. Because of their first cycle, some of the members now have experience in groups for which they know how to adequately administrate the resources that they are awarded and know the full responsibility that is required to continue to grow with the support of the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Viii De Diciembre Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal " VII D. diciembre" esta representada por la señora Giovanna Angélica y conformada por 12 miembros dentro del cual existe un parentesco consanguíneo entre la señora Neyza y su hija Leticia, ambas tienen ingresos independientes por lo que el grupo no presenta mayores inconvenientes. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. comida, cosméticos por catálogos, refrescos, tarjetas y al servicio D. transporte publico. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en la compra D. telas al por mayor, mercadería acorD. a la época e insumos para elaborar mas y mejores productos. A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo algunas D. las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar adecuadamente los fondos que se les otorga y conocen a cabalidad la responsabilidad que se requiere para seguir creciendo con el apoyo D. la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “VII of December” are represented by Giovanna Angélica. The group consists of 12 members, of which Neyza and her daughter Leticia are blood related, however, they both have independent sources of income and as such they do not present any inconvenience to the group. The members of this Communal Bank run different businesses, such as: the sale of food, cosmetics through catalog, drinks, cards, and public transportation services. Like in every commercial sector, there always exists supply and demand competition, but the group members know how to get ahead and obtain the best profits to be able to proviD. their families a better quality of life.

This loan will be used to diversify their products and to invest in the purchase of wholesale fabrics, in-season merchandise, and supplies to make more and better products. Despite this being their first loan cycle, some of the group members have previous experience in solidarity groups through which they know how to properly administer funds that they are granted, and know the commitment and responsibility that is required to continue growing with the support of the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to diversify their products, invest in the purchase of wholesale fabrics, in-season merchandise, and supplies).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Señor De Laguanas Group

texts.es:
Señor de Laguanas es un grupo numero de 16 integrantes, se agruparon hace poco y desean estar mucho tiempo juntas. La mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a negocios de producción como el tejido de mantas y chompas, confección de polleras (faldas para mujeres), elaboración de matracas. Ellas desean ampliar su negocio comprando materia prima como tela y lana, otras se dedican a la comercialización de verduras y por último dos socias se dedican a la atenciónde cabinas telefónicas.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para mejorar o ampliar sus negocios, comprando mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
“Señor de Laguanas” [“Our lord of Laguanas”] is a group composed of 16 members; they came together recently and they hope to remain together for a long time. The majority of group member have businesses in the production of knitted sheets and jackets, making ‘polleras’ (traditional women’s underskirts), and making rattles; they hope to expand their businesses by purchased basic materials such as cloth and wool. Other group members have businesses in the sale of vegetables, and the last two members provide phone booth services.

They all need this loan to improve and expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise and basic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and basic materials.

loans.name: Independientes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Independientes” esta representado por la señora Marisol y conformado por 13 miembros que son de bajos ingresos, pero muy trabajadoras y con expectativas de lograr crecer en sus negocios para dales a su familia un futuro mejor. Las socias desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales como la venta en abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, venta de comida, cosméticos, atención en puntos viva, ropa, acentúas, zapatos y a la construcción de muebles de madera, una mayoría trabaja en su domicilio y el resto como vendedores ambulantes. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores están presentes en el barrio, pero las socias tienen sus clientes que  constantemente generan el movimiento económico necesario para el ingreso diario, en caso de que no les va muy bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugares para realizar la comercialización de sus productos o diversifican su actividad económica de forma que puedan cumplir con sus responsabilidades y su familia. El destino del crédito es la adquisición mercadería para surtir sus tiendas e Insumos para generar una mayor ganancia que ayude a brindar a su familia una mejor calida de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando ya su cuarto ciclo demostrando ganas de salir adelante, responsabilidad y honestidad para con su grupo.
texts.en:
Marisol represents the Independientes group, which is comprised of 13 members with low incomes. But they are very hard-workers, and they have expectations to grow in their businesses in order to give their families a better future. The members work in different types of commercial activities like selling groceries in neighborhood store, selling food, cosmetics, phone calling services, clothes, accessories, shoes, and making wooden furniture. A majority of them work in their homes. The rest are street vendors. As far as the competition goes, we can say that there are competitors in the neighborhood. But the members have their regular customers who generate the necessary economic movement for daily income. In case it does not go well in the neighborhood, they head to other places to sell their products or do their work so that they can meet their responsibilities for themselves and their families. The loan is to get merchandise to stock their stores and to get supplies to generate greater earnings. This will help give their families a better quality of life. As far as their loan experience goes, the members are in their fourth cycle. They demonstrate the desire to get ahead, responsibility, and honesty for their group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for painting

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es: El grupo "San Expedito" esta representado por la señora Anita del Rosario y conformado por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedica al comercio de diferentes productos como comida, cosméticos, repuestos, artesanías y al servicio de jardinería y poda de árboles. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre la señora Eugenia y la señora presidenta ellas son hermanas, pero cuentan con ingresos independientes. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación de productos y para invertir en la compra de telas al por mayor, mercadería acorde a la época e insumos para elaborar mas y mejores productos. Las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo dentro de la institución por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como administrar los fondos con responsabilidad y honestidad, es por esta razón que la fundación les brinda un segundo apoyo económico para que puedan sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “San Expedito” is represented by Mrs. Anita del Rosario and made up of 12 members, most of whom work in businesses dealing with different types of products such as food, cosmetics, spare parts, handicrafts, and in the service of gardening and the pruning of trees. Within the group, there is a sister-like kinship between Eugenia and the president, Mrs. Anita, but they rely on themselves, and have independent incomes. As in all commerce there is always the competition of supply and demand, but the associates know how to come out ahead; to earn the best incomes in order to give their families the best quality of life. This loan is intended for the diversification of products, and to invest in the purchase of fabrics in bulk, merchandise agreeing with the times and supplies to produce more products of higher quality. The associates are proceeding with their second cycle in the institution, so they can rely on their experience with mutual support within a group, and know how to administer the funds with responsibility and honesty. It is for this reason that the foundation has blessed them with this second economic assistance, such that they can progress their businesses for the sake of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the size of his business

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
Roca Fuerte es un grupo de personas que forma parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, una de sus integrantes es Esthela Patricia P. de 20 años, cuenta que desde muy niña colaboró a su madre a vender alcancías y cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad su madre le regaló  dinero  para que ella pueda vender de manera independiente. Esthela desea hacer crecer su negocio, por este motivo a invitación de una amiga se animó  a formar parte del grupo Roca Fuerte y necesita el préstamo para comprar mayor mercadería, para luego venderlo en diferentes ferias y pueblos de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Las demás integrantes de Roca Fuerte tambien tienen sus propias actividades económicas, como la venta de lana, vajillas, celulares, carne y juguetes, también necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.
texts.en:
Roca Fuerte (Strong Rock) is a group of people that is made up of members of the Centro Focal Alto Lima. One of the members is Esthela Patricia P., a 20-year-old woman who from a very young age has worked with her mother selling piggy banks. When she legally came of age, her mother gave her money so that she could begin selling independently. Esthela wants to grow her business, and for this reason joined the Roca Fuerte group at the invitation of a friend. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise to later sell at different markets and in different areas of the city of La Paz. The other members of Roca Fuerte also have their own businesses, such as the sale of wool, dishes, cellular phones, meat, or toys. They too need this loan to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for sale.

loans.name: San Luis Pampa Group

texts.es:
Trece mujeres formaron la asociación “San Luis Pampa”, ellas se reunirán quincenalmente para cumplir con sus actividades en el centro focal Cascada. 
Entre los diversos negocios que tiene el grupo, encontramos a socias que se dedican a la costura, elaboración y venta de comida, tejidos, comercio de mercadería de todo tipo y por temporadas. Esta asociación requiere de capital, principalmente para comprar mercadería o materia prima, desean abastecer sus negocios para generar recursos y hacer frente a las necesidades de sus familias.
texts.en:
Thirteen women form the "San Luis Pampa" association and meet bi-weekly at the Cascada center for their activities. Among the varios businesses the group is involved with, we find members who do sewing, food preparation and sales, knitting, retail and seasonal sales. This group needs funds principally to purchase raw materials or inventory to supply their businesses and generate funds with which to meet their family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: El Quior Group

texts.es: Las socias que conforman el grupo residen en la zona D. “El Quiro”  es D. ahí el nombre del Banco Comunal, El grupo va cursando ya su tercer ciclo a la presidencia del la señora Mirian, demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad, puntualidad y ganas D. trabajar es por esta razón que la fundación Agrocapital le da un nuevo apoyo económico para que sigan adelante. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a al venta D. productos como cosméticos, ropa, zapato, comida, abarrote en tiendas D. barrio, artesanías y servicio D. peluquería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en la compra D. telas al por mayor, mercadería acorD. a la época e insumos para elaborar mas y mejores productos.
texts.en:
The members of this group all live in the "El Quiro" neighborhood, hence the name of the Communal Bank. This is their third cycle under the leadership of Mrs. Mirian. They have demonstrated responsibility, honesty, puctuality and a desire to work and for these reasons, Agrocapital approves a new economic incentive for them to continue forward. Most of the members are involved in cosmetic, clothing, footwear, food and grocery sales as well as handicrafts, neighborhood stores and barber supplies and services. As in all commercial activities, competition and supply and demand exist but these members have learned how to progress and continue to reap good incomes to better proviD. for their families. This loan will be used to diversify inventory, to purchase wholesale fabric, seasonal merchandise, and raw materials with which to produce better and more varied products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Funds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Las Inseparables Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Inseparables” están representadas por la señora Sandra y conformada por 12 miembros ellas van cursando su tercer ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como horneados, comida, abarrotes, cosméticos por catalogo, ropa americana, comida, cotillones y adornos. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desD. 2 ciclos anteriores recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios y al incremento D. su mercadería para ofrecer al M. un producto D. mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas D. las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinD. a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 12 members of the "Las Inseparables" group, led by Mrs. Sandra, are in their third cycle with the institution having demonstrated responsibility, honesty and a desire to get ahead to keep growing with the economic help from the institution. Most of the members are involved in sales of such items as: prepared meals, food, groceries, catalog cosmetic sales, American clothing sales, food, party supplies and decorations. The work of the past two cycles is now beginning to show benefits which creates the need for a new loan so that their businesses can grow and they can increase their inventory in order to offer the marketplace a higher quality product that is more competitive. The members expect to have a productive enterprise that will afford their families a better quality of life and better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Funds.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has worked as a butcher and a cook for 16 years. People often told him that his cooking was so good he should make a business out of it. Last year, James started his own catering business in a church kitchen. He makes and sells tamales and smoked meats, including ribs, links, lamb, duck, and goat. 

One of James’ main challenges is the high cost of cooking and catering equipment. He can only afford to purchase a little at a time. He is proud to have purchased his smoker, his biggest purchase so far, with his own savings. 

James needs a loan to help him purchase a mobile food cart. He plans to sell his tamales and meats in California parks, so people will know where to find him and his products. In the future, James hopes to have his own kitchen so that he can expand his business to its full potential, including a staff of two employees. 

James is excited about working wtih Opportunity Fund, not only for the chance of getting a loan to buy the cart, but also for teaching him important business skills to help him run and expand his business effectively. He feels good about his future and about finally taking the risk to become an entrepreneur.

loans.use: Mobile food cart

loans.name: Laura Mercedes

texts.es: Laura Mercedes N. Sánchez tiene la edad de 48 años. Es una señora con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Vive en su propia casa con sus hijos. Todos los días su trabajo comienza desde muy temprano ya que desde hace 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo que no es la primera vez que ha realizado financiamientos para salir adelante con su negocio, ya que es por medio de los esfuerzos que hace día a día pude sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles las oportunidad de estudio. Ella comenzó con muy pocos productos como ropa y cosméticos por lo que inicialmente solo le ofrecía a sus familiares y amistades y por medio del tiempo fue que logro obtener más clientes. Ahora ella recurre a Fundación León 2000 para facilitarle un financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo para mercadería en general.
texts.en:
Laura Mercedes N. Sánchez is 48 years old. She is a lady with a very enterprising spirit. She lives in her own house with her children. Her work begins very early every day and she has been in this business for the last 4 years. This is not the first time that she is looking for a loan to get ahead in her business. Through the work that she puts in day to day she has been able to get her children ahead and offer them the opportunity to study. She started with very few products such as clothing and cosmetics which she initially only sold to friends and family, as time went on she obtained more customers. She is now turning to Fundación León 2000 for a loan that will be used for working capital, obtaining general merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Santitas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Santitas” se encuentra representado por la señora Maria Elena y conformado por 12 miembros muy unidos y dinámicos para realizar actividades en grupo. En general las socias se dedican a diversas actividades como por ejemplo la señora Maria Elena se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su tienda D. barrio y con su negocio mantiene a sus tres niños, el resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta del periódico, detergentes, cosméticos por catálogos, ropa interior, atención en ferretería, comida, servicio D. manicura, al servicio domestico y lavado D. ropa. La competencia hoy en día es alta, pero lo importante es que ellas tienen clientes fijos y siempre cumplen con lo que les ofrece a sus clientes por lo que cuentan con su confianza, en la venta D. productos a nivel general hay mucha competencia pero sus negocios son muy rentable pero sacrificado ya que trabajan D. lunes a domingo, pero gracias a ello su familia cuenta con un pan en la mesa y educación. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en la compra D. telas al por mayor, mercadería acorD. a la época e insumos para elaborar mas y mejores productos. A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo algunas D. las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. por lo que saben administrar adecuadamente los fondos que se les otorga y conocen a cabalidad la responsabilidad que se requiere para seguir creciendo con el apoyo D. la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is the representative of communal bank “Las Santitas". Its 12 members are very close and dynamic where it concerns group activities. As a general rule, group members engage in different activities. Ms. Maria Elena, for instance, sells groceries in her neighborhood store and is able to support her three children with the business. Other members sell newspapers, detergents, cosmetics through catalogues and underwear, still others proviD. services in hardware, food, manicure, housecleaning and laundry. There is currently a lot of competition. The important thing, though, is that group members have regular customers who trust them and their services as they always fulfill their orders. Competition in sales is stiff, but the group’s businesses are very profitable, though they require hard work, evidence of which is the fact that members work seven days a week. They are able to proviD. food and education for their families thanks to their hard work. The loan is to be used to add new product lines, to invest in fabric in wholesale quantities, to buy merchandise more in tune with current needs and to buy supplies to increase manufacture and improve on their products. Even though this is the first loan the group requests, some individual members have previously participated with other communal groups. They already know how to manage loans and understand fully that by meeting their obligations they will be able to continue to grow and enjoy the support of Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yanapasiñani Group

texts.es: ”Yanapasiñani” en lengua aymará significa “ Ayudémonos entre nosotros”, es la denominación que adoptan dieciséis mujeres, que trabajan hace siete años junto a Pro-Mujer. Esta asociación  se dedica principalmente al comercio y en algunos casos la preparación de comida, por ejemplo Pastora tiene una pensión donde ofrece almuerzos y cenas, Juana vende frutas, Maria vende muñecos de peluche, Angélica que es una de las fundadoras se dedica hace seis años a la venta de ropa, Sofía vende ropa interior, Esta asociación afirman que precisan capital para poder reactivar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Yanapasiñani, an Aymara word, means Let Us Help One Another. The name was chosen by these sixteen women, who have been working the last seven years with the support of Pro-Mujer. The association engages primarily in commercial ventures, including food preparation and sales. For example, Pastora owns a boarding house where she serves lunch and dinner, Juana sells fruit, Maria sells stuffed toys, founding member Angelica has sold clothing for the past six years, Sofia sells underwear. The association needs capital to improve the members’ individual businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work tools

loans.name: 14 De Julio Group

texts.es: Venta de víveres, calzados, ropa, cosméticos, dulces, pasteles y carbón son los negocios de las integrantes del grupo 14 de Julio que se fundó hace 7 años aproximadamente. Es el caso de Rosa V.  de 48 años, es parte del grupo hace 2 años ella ingresó por invitación de una amiga que vive en su zona, Rosa tiene el negocio de elaboración y venta de carbón, inicio su negocio hace 7 años, su esposo es quien  elabora el carbón y ella lo vende en una tienda que se ubica en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto y tiene mayor demanda los días viernes, sábado y domingo. Rosa es madre de 5 hijos, dos de los cuales viven con ella porque son pequeños, ella necesita el préstamo para comprar madera que trae de Yacuiba.
texts.en:
Group 14 de Julio was founded about seven years ago. Its members sell groceries, shoes, clothing, cosmetics, candy, pastries and coal. Forty-eight year old Rosa V., for example, has been a member for two years. She was invited to join by a friend who lives in her area. Rosa makes and sells coal. She started the business seven years ago. Her husband makes the coal and she sells it at a store located in Ceja, in El Alto. The coal is in highest demand on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. Rosa has five children, the two younger ones live with her. She needs the loan to buy the wood she brings from Yacuiba.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: El Gallito Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Gallito” esta representado por la señora Nidia y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos, comida rápida, licores artesanales y ropa interior. En el anterior ciclo se tuvieron inconvenientes debido a la enfermedad repentina D. uno D. sus integrantes, pero  el trabajo en equipo y las ganas D. seguir trabajando saco a flote a todo el grupo sin mayores percances. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en la compra D. insumos al por mayor, mercadería acorD. a la época y herramientas para elaborar mas y mejores productos. Las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo dentro D. la institución por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como administrar los fondos con responsabilidad y honestidad, es por esta razón que la fundación les brinda un tercer apoyo económico para que puedan sacar adelante a sus familias. 
Capital D. Operraciones
texts.en:
The "El Gallito" group is led by Señora Nidia and composed of 12 members who sell cosmetics, fast food, artesenal spirits, and underwear. In their previous business cycle, they had some setbacks due to the sudden illness of a member, but working as a group and the desire to continue working kept everyone afloat without further mishap. As in the entire commercial sector, there exists the competition of supply and demand, but these members know how to forge ahead in order to earn the best incomes to then give to their families so they can have a better quality of life. This loan will be used to diversify the group's product lines and to invest in buying products at wholesale, up-to-date merchandise, and the tools to develop the best products. The members are beginning their second business cycle with the organization therefore they have experience working together in solidarity and know how to administrate their funds responsibly and honestly. Because of these reasons, the foundation grants them a third of their economic support so that they and their families can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Superpoderosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Superpoderosas” están representadas por la señora Maida y conformada por 12 miembros ellas van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como cosméticos, joyas de plata, comida, ropa interior pan y al servicio de peluquería. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desde su primer ciclo recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios y al incremento de su mercadería para ofrecer al mercado un producto de mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas de las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinde a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Superpoderosas" group is led by Señora Maida and is comprised of 12 members who are in the midst of their second cycle with the institution, demonstrating responsibility, honesty, and the desire to move ahead and continue growing with the economic support that the institution provides. Most of the members sell cosmetics, silver jewelry, food, breads, underwear, or provide hairdressing services. The strength that these women have brought since their first business cycle has recently begun to bear fruit; therefore the new need for a loan will be used to grow their businesses and to increase their merchandise in order to put high quality and competitive products on the market. The members' hope is to have a productive business that provides their families with a better quality of life and a better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Iluciones Group

texts.es:
Hace seis meses se formo la asociación “Ilusiones”, se reúnen en el centro focal Villa Exaltación, ala cabeza de Gloria J. , trabajan de forma responsable en todas sus actividades de grupo. Entre los distintos negocios que tiene esta asociación , vemos que la mayoría  de las socias se dedican al comercio de mercadería de todo tipo por ejemplo, venta de cosméticos, celulares, productos en base a la soya (manteca, carne, leche), víveres, y otros. En su mayoría, las socias poseen puestos de venta en ferias y mercados específicos dependiendo de la mercadería con la que comercian y otras al carecer de un puesto se dedican a la venta ambulante.
La asociación Ilusiones, necesita capital para ampliar su mercadería, están seguros que lograran realizar una buena inversión en sus rubros para beneficio y mejora de la calidad de vida  de ellas y sus familias
texts.en:
The "Ilusiones" association formed six months ago. They meet in the center of Villa Exaltación, and, headed by Gloria J., they work in a responsible manner on all of the group's activities. Among their different businesses, the majority of the members sell merchandise of all kinds: cosmetics, cell phones, soy products (butter, meat substitute, milk), food, and others. In general, the members have their business stands at specific fairs and markets depending on the kind of products they sell, and the others who don't have fixed spot sell their products on foot. The "Ilusiones" group needs capital in order to expand their merchandise. They are positive they will see the benefits of investing in more items and will improve the quality of life for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying additional merchandise

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Gotitas de Amor” fue formada en el año 2008, se encuentra ubicado en la zona alta de huaycan, distrito de ate, departamento lima, esta conformada por 10 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: venta de especerías, venta de pollo, venta de abarrotes, venta de carne, servicio de costura, servicio de moto taxi, servicio de peluquería, servicio de locutorio, pensión a estudiantes, etc.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 1 año actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal  la señora Sonia L., natural de lima tiene 32 años conviviente y con 2 hijos, desde hace 2 años se dedica  a la venta de  especerías en el mercado viene trabajando en este negocio, gracias a  su madre quien la motivo a tener su propio negocio.
Con su reciente préstamo Sonia comprara mercadería para su pequeño puesto y así poder abastecer  a sus clientes con los insumos necesarios.
 En el futuro le gustaría mucho poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Gotitas de Amor Communal Bank was formed in 2008. It is located in the area of Alta Huaycan, Ate district, Lima department. The group is comprised of ten members who are engaged in various activities like selling spices, selling chicken, selling groceries, selling meat, tailoring, “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized cart) services, hairdressing services, phone café services, and meals for students, etc. The group has worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for one year. Sonia L., originally from Lima, is currently the president of the communal bank. She is 32, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She sells spices in the market. She has been working in this business for two years, thanks to her mother who motivated her to have her own business. With her recent loan Sonia will buy merchandise for her small stall. That way she is able to provide her customers with the necessary supplies. In the future she would very much like to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her small stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase red oil and other accessories.

loans.name: Candelarias Group

texts.es:
En la zona Collpani de la ciudad de El Alto, se encuentra el Centro Focal del mismo nombre, que agrupa a varias mujeres de escasos recursos y apoyarles brindándoles servicios de capacitación, atención en salud, ahorro y crédito, para que puedan mejorar su calidad de vida. Candelarias es un grupo de 13 mujeres que se agruparon hace cuatro años aproximadamente para acceder al préstamo e invertir en sus negocios.
Diferentes son los negocios de las integrantes de Candelarias como la venta de comida, dulces, cosméticos, juguetes, otras se dedican a actividades económicas de producción como la confección de deportivos. Ellas requieren del préstamo  para comprar mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
In the Collpani region of the city of El Alto you will find the Communal Center of the same name. Various women of scarce resources gather for support offered through training, health services, and savings and loans so that they can improve their quality of life. Candelarias is a group of 13 women who got together approximately four years ago to get access to loans and invest in their businesses. The members of Candelarias have different businesses like selling food, sweets, cosmetics, and toys. Others are involved in production like making warm-up suits. She needs a loan to buy merchandise and raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es: El grupo “Divino Niño Jesús” están representadas por la señora Mery Ines y conformada por 12 miembros ellas van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como cosméticos, ropa, comidan y a actividades como el servicio de peluquería, carpintería y panadería. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desde su primer ciclo recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios y al incremento de su mercadería para ofrecer al M. un producto de mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas de las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinde a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mery Ines represents the Divino Niño Jesús group, which is comprised of 12 members. They are in their second cycle with the Institution. They demonstrate responsibility, honesty, and the desire to get ahead in order to keep growing with the economic support the Institution offers them. The majority of the members sell products like cosmetics, clothes, and food. They also are involved in activities like hairdressing services, carpentry, and a bakery. The effort they have been making since their first cycle is recently starting to bear fruit. The newly needed loan is for business growth and an increase in merchandise to be able to offer a better quality and more competitive product to the market. The members’ expectations are to have a productive business that gives their families a better quality of life and a better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tools for his shop and for spare parts.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa Margarita Téllez C. tiene 42 años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y amorosa con sus 3 hijos actualmente todos estudian y están a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos, ella disfruta cada día salir a ofrecer sus productos ya que cada uno de sus clientes tiene diferentes necesidades además, sus disfrutan conversar con ella. Ella dio inicio hace mas de 7 años por lo que todos los días por la tarde salía de su casa para buscar nuevos clientes y mejorar su forma de vida, y así fue que poco a poco fue creciendo con su negocio. El financiamiento que ella solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de lápiz labial, sombra, cremas, colonias y prendas de oro laminado. Su deseo es establecer una tienda para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Margarita Téllez C. is 42 years old. She is a hardworking and loving woman with 3 children who are currently in school and in her care. She sells cosmetics, and enjoys going out every day to offer her products, conversing with her customers who each have different needs. For 7 years she has left the house each afternoon to look for new customers and improve her way of life, and this way her business gradually grew. The financing that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase lipstick, eye shadow, cremes, colognes and gold-plated jewelry. Her desire is to establish a store that would supply the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Perlas Y Diamantes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Perlas y Diamantes” están representadas por la señora Angélica y conformada por 12 miembros ellas van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como ropa, cotillones, pan, cosméticos, comida, dulces y al servicio domestico y a la atención D. cafés Internet. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desD. su primer ciclo recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios y al incremento D. su mercadería para ofrecer al mercado un producto D. mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas D. las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinD. a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angélica represents the Perlas y Diamantes group, which is comprised of 12 members. They are in their second cycle with the Institution. They demonstrate responsibility, honesty, and the desire to get ahead in order to keep growing with the economic support the Institution offers them. The majority of the members sell products like clothes, party favors, cosmetics, food, and sweets. They also are involved in activities like maid service and running Internet cafes. The effort they have been making since their first cycle is recently starting to bear fruit. The newly needed loan is for business growth and an increase in merchandise to be able to offer a better quality and more competitive product to the market. The members’ expectations are to have a productive business that gives their families a better quality of life and a better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Los Portales De Pariachi Group

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Sánchez tiene 66 años casada con 9 hijos vive en los Portales D. Pariachi distrito D. Ate departamento D. Lima.

Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 9 meses, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Los Portales D. Pariachi” conformada por 10 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades: producción comercio y servicios. 

Cristina tiene un restaurante denominado “OLI” desD. hace 10 años,  empezó a  con este negocio para apoyar y mejorar la calidad D. educación D. sus hijos, también se dedica al alquiler D.  locales comerciales.
Hasta el momento a logrado construir su casa, y apoyar a sus hijos en la universidad
Con su reciente préstamo  invertirá  para abrir otro restaurante con su hija en una zona comercial en Chosica.
En el futuro le gustaría techar sus locales comerciales para alquilarlos y así poder generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs Cristina Sánchez, 66, married, has nine children and lives in the district of Portales D. Pariachi, in the department of Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for nine months and currently occupies the role of president of the communal bank "Los Portales D. Pariachi", maD. up of ten partners who carry out different activities: production, traD. and services.

Cristina has had a restaurant called "OLI" for ten years. She started this business to support and improve the quality of her children's education and also works in renting commercial premises. Until now, she has been able to build her house and support her children at university.
