With the new loan, Cristina will invest in opening another restaurant with her daughter in a commercial area of Chosica. In the future, she would like to roof her commercial premises to rent them and thereby generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in opening another restaurant with her daughter in a commercial area of Chosica.

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es: La Joven Yesenia A. R., tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el barrio las dispersas, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como jardinero en una residencial Campos Azules, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo de dos años de edad , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Yessenia desde hace 15 años se dedica a la actividad agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio con el apoyo de su mamá ya que sus padres han sobresalido en su vida por las siembras , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo, con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de químicos como: fertilizantes, venenos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una mejor producción para vender  a mejor precio en el mercado. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras a sus siembra como en lo personal.
texts.en:
Yesenia A. R. is 27 years old. She is a young woman who lives in the neighborhood of Las Dispersas, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. Her husband works as a gardener in the residential district of Campos Azules. They both contribute toward the household expenses and support their two year old son. Their plans include improving their living conditions.

Doña Yessenia has been farming for 15 years. Her greatest challenge has been a lack of financing. She began farming with the help of her mother since both of her parents made their living by planting and harvesting crops. She hopes to diversify her own crops in the future.

With this loan, she plans to buy chemicals, such as fertilizers and herbicides, which she will apply to her crops so that she can improve her production and command better prices at the market. She thanks the Institution for enabling her to make improvements in both her livelihood and her personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & herbicides to improve her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the size of her business.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: Roger Antonio A. M. tiene 31 años. Es un hombre muy responsable vive con su compañera de vida. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar servicio de reparación de vidrios automotrices. Hace más de 6 años que inicio con este negocio con ahorros que tenia, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a brindar los servicios de construcción todos los días Roger trabajaba y tenía que transportarse en una bicicleta pero debido a que los lugares a los que iban eran muy lejanos y pasaba mucho tiempo lejos de su familia, por lo que decide establecer su propio negocio y así con el tiempo fue adquiriendo clientes. El solicita el financiamiento para la compra de herramientas para su negocio. El deseo de Roger es terminar de construir su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Roger Antonio A. M. is 31 years old. He is a very responsible man who lives with his partner in life. He provides auto glass repair services. Roger started his business 6 years ago using his own savings. He was previously in the construction business and had to travel to distant places on a bicycle. Because of his work, he was forced to spend a lot of time away from his family, so he decided to start his own business. Over time, he has been able to acquire customers.

The loan Roger requested will be used to buy tools for his business. He hopes to finish construction of his modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his auto glass repair business

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es: El señor Pablo Enrique C. Hernández , tiene la edad de 38 años , habita en el barrio , los ríos , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa particular , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos de catorce y diez años , actualmente estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Pablo se siente contento con el apoyo que le hemos brindado ya que con el primer crédito tuvo resultados muy positivos , hasta pago antes del tiempo determinado , a la vez compro parte de materiales para su vivienda , con este segundo desembolso va a inducir mas los cultivos junto con la accesoria del técnico para establecer una parte mas de piña . Agradece ala institución por su buena aprobación con el financiamiento ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician con estos préstamos y que solo mediante este medio se puede prosperar debido a la crisis económica.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo Enrique C. Hernández is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Rios. Together with his wife, who works as a housekeeper at a private residence, they provide for the household expenses and support their two school-aged children (ages 14 and 10). They plan to improve the living conditions for their family.

Don Pablo is very happy with the support we provided through his first loan. The results were positive and he was able to repay ahead of schedule. The previous loan was used to buy materials for his house.

With this second loan, he hopes to increase his crop output by hiring a technician to help him set aside part of his land for growing pineapple. He thanks the Institution for approving his financing. Don Pablo believes many families could benefit from these loans as a means of helping them prosper in an economic crisis.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed & pay for technical support for growing pineapples

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sol Radiante inicia su ciclo 41 con 19 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. condimentos, cereales, frutas, ropa, quesos, cosméticos, golosinas, zapatos y servicios D. cosmetología.
	
Como es el caso D. Rosa que tiene un salón D. belleza en un local alquilado, en donD. también venD. cosméticos, artículos D. regalo, golosinas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. un personal.
	
Por otro lado Ricardina venD. desayunos todas las mañanas, D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado 12 D. abril.
	 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles  haciendo un total D. 12,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. azúcar, leche, tintes, artículos D. regalo, frutas, condimentos, ropa y quesos.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus negocios mejoren, sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tener negocios estables.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sol Radiante” (Radiant Sun) is starting its 41st loan cycle with 19 members. They have businesses selling condiments, grain, fruit, clothing, cheese, cosmetics, candy, shoes, and beauty services. Such is the case with Rosa, who operates a beauty salon from a rented space. She also sells cosmetics, gift items, and candy with the help of an employee.

Another example is Ricardina, who sells breakfast every morning as a traveling merchant in the “12 D. Abril” Market.

The members need loans of different amounts ranging from 400 soles, 600 soles, to 800 soles for a total of 12,200 soles for the entire Communal Bank. The money will be used to buy sugar, milk, dyes, gift items, fruit, condiments, clothing, and cheese.

The members dream of improving and stabilizing their businesses, as well as seeing their children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, milk, dyes, gift items, fruit, condiments, clothing, and cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the size of her business.

loans.name: Sumaq Warmikuna Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sumaq Warmikuna que significa Mujeres Bellas inicia su tercer ciclo con 14 socias. Las socias son D. L. comunidad D. Yanama que se encuentra a 30 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, calzados, verduras, abarrotes en general, comidas, artesanías, animales menores, lubricantes, cosméticos y frutas.
	
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 6,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. trigo, cebada, arroz, azúcar, verduras, carnes, frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sumaq Warmikuna” (which means Beautiful Women) is starting its third loan cycle with 14 members. They are from Yanama, which is 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho.

The members are engaged in different retail businesses selling grain, shoes, vegetables, groceries, food, handicrafts, small livestock, lubricants, cosmetics, and fruit.

They need loans of different amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles for a total of 6600 soles for the entire Communal Bank. With their loans, they plan to buy wheat, barley, rice, sugar, vegetables, meats, and fruits.

The members hope to expand their businesses, own their own homes, and see their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley, rice, sugar, vegetables, meats, and fruits

loans.name: Brenda Vanessa

texts.es: Brenda Vanessa Rodríguez Velázquez tiene 36 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella se levanta temprano ya que todos los días tiene que buscar los alimentos necesarios para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos como gallo pinto, queso frito, tajadas, empanadas de maduro y pollo frito. Actualmente todos los días saca una mesa en la que ofrece cada uno de sus platillos, por lo que sus clientes disfrutan mucho de su comida, ya que poco a poco fue estableciendo su propia fama. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, pollos, azúcar y ciertos utensilios de cocina. Su deseo es establecer un restaurante.
texts.en:
Brenda Vanessa Rodríguez Velázquez is 36 years old. She has been cooking for a living for the past 4 years. She wakes up early every day to buy the necessary ingredients to cook her delicious recipes, like the traditional dishes gallo pinto (fried rice and beans with spices), queso frito (fried cheese), tajadas (fried plantain slices), empanadas and fried chicken. Every day she sets a table selling her dishes, and she's slowly becoming famous with her clients for the quality and taste of her food. She will use the money to buy basic grains, oil, chicken, sugar and some kitchen tools. She dreams of opening her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food and kitchen supplies

loans.name: Felipe Hernaldo

texts.es: El señor Felipe P. de 50 años de edad, trabaja en auto lavado y vulcanización desde hace 14 años, se ha esforzado por lograr tener un trabajo digno y propio. Reside en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian para lograr tener a futuro una carrera profesional, el inicio este negocio con una vulcanización la cual aun la conserva para tener ingresos y poder costearse los costos y salir adelante con el negocio. Sus planes es poder remodelar el local para brindar cada día un mejor servicio al público. Con este préstamo comprara llantas, aceite y otros productos para el auto lavado, con este inversión traerá mucho beneficios ya que incrementara el inventario y ventas lo cual generara ganancias para sus gatos y pago. A si como mejorar la infraestructura para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Felipe P. is 50 years old and has been working at a car wash and tire repair shop for the past 14 years. He has worked hard to establish his own modest business. He lives in the neighborhood of Casimiro Sotelo in the capital of Managua. He and his wife have three children who are studying to become career professionals in the future.

He started his tire repair shop in order generate an income, and he has been able to maintain a successful business. He plans to remodel his shop so that he can provide good service to the public every day. With this loan, he will buy tires, wax, and other car wash products. He believes this investment will provide many benefits and will increase his sales. Therefore, he will bring home more income and be able to make his loan payments. He plans to improve the infrastructure of his home in the future for the sake of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires, wax, and other car wash products

loans.name: Gricelda Antonieta

texts.es: La señorita es originaria de la comunidad de chiyax a un kilometro de la ciudad su principal fuente de ingreso es la elaboracion blusas, y delantales para damas dicha actividad lo aprendio de su querida madrecita hace diez años con una maquina sencilla hasta la fecha ha incrementado su produccion al utilizar una maquina ya moderna hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materilales, como tela, conos models forros ya que tiene un pedido por ser la fiesta del municipio y la cual ella quiere aprovechar esta ocaccion.
texts.en:
Gricelda is from the community of Chiyax, one kilometer outside the city. Her principal source of income is through the production of blouses and aprons for women. She learned how to do this from her mother 10 years ago with a simple machine, but now that her production level has increased, she uses a modern sewing machine. She currently needs a loan for the purchase of materials such as cloth and other supplies so that she can take advantage of an order she has for the upcoming town hall party.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario de nombre Mujeres Unidas  está compuesto por Maria Benita Rodríguez S. y Maura Estela E.. Ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como las siguientes: Doña Maria tiene 45 años de edad y tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Doña Maria es la venta de cerdos. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y poco a poco ha incrementado su negocio por lo que con la ayuda de su amiga Maura han decidió unirse para realizar un financiamiento que sea de apoyo para ambas. La Señora Maura tiene 44 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Maura. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que los financiamientos son el apoyo para que su negocio salga adelante y unida con Maria solicitan un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así cada una pueda invertir en sus respectivos negocios. El sueño de ambas es que Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones siempre estén dispuestas a brindar la ayuda para mejorar la situación.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group called “Mujeres Unidas” (Women United) is composed of Maria Benita Rodríguez S. and Maura Estela E.. Both women are engaged in different business activities such as the following: Doña Maria is 45 years old and has 1 child. She has been selling pigs for more than 7 years and has steadily increased her business with the help of her friend Maura. They have decided to apply jointly for a loan that will help them both. Sra. Maura is 44 years old and married. She has been operating a grocery store for more than 8 years. She knows that financing will help her business succeed, so she has joined with Maria to request a loan so that they can invest in their respective businesses. The dream of both women is that Fundación León 2000 and other organizations continue to provide assistance to anyone looking to improve their situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Guadalupe Socorro

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe es originaria del municipio de San Cristobal Totonicapan  su principal actividad es la venta y compra de animales  domesticos  lleva ya mas de diez años realizando dicha actividad  que sobre salido dando educación a sus hijos hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de animales ya que en el  mes octubre es la feria de San Francisco el alto y quiere aprovechar dicha feria para obtener algunos ingreso para mejor su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Guadalupe is originally from the town of San Cristobal Totonicapan. She has been buying and selling domesticated animals for more than 10 years. Through her business activity, she has been able to provide for her children’s education.

Today she is requesting a loan to purchase animals. The fair in San Francisco takes place in October and she would like to take advantage of this opportunity to earn some income so that she can improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her available capital for purchasing animals

loans.name: Juanita Damaris

texts.es: Su nombre es Juanita Damaris D. Salmerón  su edad es de 38 años, su estado civil es casada esta señora tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, en sus deseos esta el mantener activo su negocio ya que por medio de este es que ha logrado obtener los ingresos que le genera a su familia. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de una manera muy humilde por lo que logro observar que es un negocio muy rentable y busca la manera más efectiva de obtener ingresos para su familia. Actualmente el está solicitando un financiamiento para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra de sabanas, faldas, pantalones, camisetas y tallas extra grandes. Sus deseos son obtener un medio de transporte para poder movilizase con mucha más eficiencia.
texts.en:
This is Juanita Damaris D. Salmerón. She is 38 years old, married, and has 3 dependent children. She hopes to maintain her business so that she can continue generating income for her family. Juanita sells clothing and has always enjoyed this simple line of work because it is very profitable and an effective way of earning money for her family.

She is currently requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy sheets, skirts, pants, shirts, and other types of clothing in extra large sizes. She hopes to obtain a mode of transportation so that she can move around for efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Eleuteria Antonia

texts.es: Doña Antonia es originaria de la comunidad de Patzarajmac Totonicapan que se encuentra ubicado a 8 kilometros de la ciudad su actividad principal es el servico como comadrona conocido en nuestro medio como ( Partera) dicha actividad  es un don que Dios le regalo hace mas de  veinte años  al servicio de su comunidad hoy necesita de un credito para comprar algunos materiales mas modernos ya que hasta la fecha ha recibido capacitacion de parte del area de salud, la cual necesita de dichas herramientas para poner en practicas los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Doña Antonia is originally from the community of Patzarajmac Totonicapan, which is located 8 kilometers away from the city. She works as a midwife in the local area. Doña Antonia believes her profession is a gift that God gave to her more than 20 years ago so that she could serve her community.

Today she needs a loan to purchase more modern materials. The health care training she has received is up-to-date, but she needs these tools so that she can put into practice the knowledge she has acquired.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for her midwifery practice

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Damaris del Carmen A. A. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casado, Doña Máxima tiene 5 hijos  y todos trabajan de manera independiente pues esto es lo que ella les ha enseñado. Sus propósitos son de engrandecer su negocio con el fin de mantener este trabajo porque es lo que más le ha gustado. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, hace mas de 4años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella dio inicio por cuenta propia pero no poseía mucha experiencia en la venta y trato de buscar la posibilidad de aprender pero no le fue tan difícil, ya que cuando ofertaba el producto lo hacía con timidez pero logro desenvolverse en este negocio y al paso del tiempo tomo cariño de  esta actividad. el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo propuesto para los productos necesarios como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Damaris del Carmen A. A. is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children who are all independent. She greatly enjoys her work, so she is proposing to expand her business. Sra. Damaris operates a grocery store out of her home and has been doing so for the past 4 years. Even though she is self-employed, she did not have much sales experience and used this business as an opportunity to learn these skills. She quickly discovered that it was not so difficult and was able to overcome her shyness. Now she absolutely loves what she does.

This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase necessary products such as candy, natural beverages, bread, cookies, and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, natural beverages, bread, cookies, and basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Install a concrete floor

loans.name: Francisca Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola esta preocupada por la educación de su esposo, el quiere entrar ala universidad para superarse y estudiar una carrera para cuando termine ganar mas dinero. Ellos quieren dar lo mejor a sus hijos y sobre todo al que viene en camino. Fabiola quiere un crédito para comprar una computadora ya que es un instrumento muy importante para la educación de su marido. Sobre todo cuando se trabaja y se estudia es un gran esfuerzo para la familia.
texts.en:
Fabiola is very concerned with her husband’s education. He would like to attend a university in order to better himself and get a degree so that he can make more money. Fabiola and her husband want to give the best to their children, especially for the baby who is on the way. Fabiola is seeking this loan in order to purchase a computer, which is a very important tool for her husband’s education. When a person works and studies, it is a great strain on the family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es: La señora Delia Maria P. G., ella tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y tiene 9 hijos 7 de ellos ya mayores de edad y 2 hijos son menores. La señora Delia es poseedora de un mototaxi, la cual sale a circular a la ciudad, que es allí en donde tiene permiso de operación. Hace 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, actualmente no es ella quien conduce el mototaxi porque a su edad no puede por lo que con  mucho esfuerzo labor como docente  impartiendo clases en un colegio público. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para la mototaxi, ya que actualmente ha sufrido unos desperfectos relacionados con la amortiguación del mismo. Su sueño es obtener otra unidad para lograr mejorar los ingresos del hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida que posee ella y sus dos hijos menores.
texts.en:
Delia Maria P. G. is 64 years old, she is married and is the mother of 9 children, 7 of whom are grown and independent, and 2 are still minors. Delia is owns a motorcycle rickshaw that she drivers around town to all the places where she has license to operate. For the past 2 years she has been running this business. She is no longer the driver of the rickshaw because at her age she can no longer take the hard work involved. Instead she gives classes at a public school. This loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for the motorcycle. Lately the motorcycle has been exhibiting problems with the shock absorbers. Her dream is to have another rickshaw so that the household income will improve and translate to a better quality of life for her and her two youngest children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ma Margarita

texts.es: Ma Margarita M. es una señora que ya va por el tercer crédito los anteriores los utilizo para su negocio es por ello que esta agradecida por esto ya que se ha ido superando poco a poco. La señora Margarita tiene un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea M.” el cual ya tiene 3 años vendiendo de todo como dulces, botana, refrescos, lácteos y abarrotes. Ella trabaja en la maquiladora y su esposo por las mañana le ayuda en el negocio para no cerrarlo durante el día, y ella no quiere dejar de trabajar para tener atención medica.
texts.en:
Ma Margarita M. is currently on her third loan cycle. She used her previous loans for her business, which is why she is grateful that she has been getting ahead little by little. Ms. Margarita M. has a general store called “Miscelánea M.,” which has been in business for 3 years. She sells candy, snacks, beverages, dairy products, and provisions. In the morning, she works at an assembly plant, so her husband minds the store so that they do not have to close during the day. She does not want to stop working because she wants to have health care.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her shop

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma A. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old and married with 2 adult children. To make a living, Thelma sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has run her shop for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Thelma recently joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.She requesting a 5000 PHP loan to purchase more seafood products for her store.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase more seafood products for her store.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeanette E. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old and is single. Jeanette owns and operates a business dealing in home products, selling Avon, Natasha and other personal collections to community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jeanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean O. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old and is single. Mary Jean owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Racma

texts.en: Racma T. is from the village of Malaigang, Iligan City. She is 44 years old, is married, and has ten school-aged children. Racma owns and operates a specialized retail store engaged in a buying and selling business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Racma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Racma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Cadidia

texts.en: Cadidia D. is from the village of Dulag, Iligan City. She is 19 years old and is single. Cadidia owns and operates a specialized retail store, engaged in a buying and selling business in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Cadidia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Dicasaran

texts.en: Dicasaran D. is from the village of Malaigang, Iligan City. He is 76 years old, is married, and has twenty-one adult children. Dicasaran owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling of goods in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Dicasaran joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 41 years old and already a widow. She has two children: Mae Joy - 16 years old, a high school graduate, and Rona - 12 years old, an elementary school graduate. Her children are her precious treasure in life and to give them a better future, Myrna ventured into a hog-raising business and also works as a dealer of Avon, Natasha and MSE products.

Myrna dreams of becoming successful in her business for the future of her children. She is now borrowing PHP 17,000 from Kiva lenders that she will use for the improvement of her business. She will buy piglets and feed for their growth.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia D. is from the village of Dulag, Iligan City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Amalia owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 45 years old and married to Petrolina, his partner in maintaining his business. He is a responsible father to their three children. They live in the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan.

Noel raises and breeds hogs for a living. Aside from that he and his wife decided to invest in a furniture shop business which they are now managing. Noel is grateful that God gave him a talent in wood carving which is a big factor in pursuing their business.

With their desire to expand the said business, Noel and his wife have decided to request additional business capital of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. Despite the hardship that they are experiencing, Noel is determined and very patient in making his business become productive. He added that: "With their faith and God's help, they were able to fight the challenges in life and were able to sustain the needs of their family."

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Elba

texts.en: Elba C. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Elba owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling rice and other food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elba joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Elba is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing net for her husband's fishing activity. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 37 years old and married to Edgar, a farmer. Farming is the major source of livelihood in their village in General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. They are blessed with three children: Maryjane - 18, Roderick - 17, and Edward – 16 years old. Clara feels sad because she was not able to provide them financial assistance to pursue their college education.

Clara is a hog raiser. She engaged in this kind of business to be able to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. She is now applying for business capital of PHP 5,000 that she will use for the maintenance of her hog-raising business.

Her dream to become productive motivates Clara to work harder and to use money wisely. She believes that the improvement of her business also depends on hard work and perseverance, aside from financial capital that she is requesting. Clara is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Anatolio

texts.en:
Anatolio B. owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling seafood products and scrap materials in his community. He is 59 years old, married and living in the village of Santiago, Iligan City. Anatolio has been in his business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Anatolio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Anatolio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offerings. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married to Remielyn and they live in the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. They do not have children yet, but they remain optimistic that they can have their own children in the future. This couple is working together at a hog raising business. Sometimes George works as a farm laborer.

George wants to borrow at least 4,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to further develop his hog raising business. According to him, the loan will not only assist him in improving his business, but also meet the needs of his family. He also intends to use his income to buy fertilizers for their small farm lot; thus, he is doing his best to earn a bigger income.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. Gloria has been in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Having successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be Gloria's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Catharine

texts.en:
Catharine has been managing a hog raising business for almost a year; it is situated in their backyard. Aside from raising hogs, she also helps her husband plant vegetables at their small farm so they can generate additional income. Catharine is 30 years old and married to Antonio, who works as a car and house painter. They live in the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. They are blessed with four children: Mary Jane – 12 years old, Anthony – 10 years old, James – 6 years old, and Carlo – 3 years old. Three of the children are studying at a public school.

Catharine is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan from Kiva lenders to buy piglets that she can sell to make her business grow. She dreams that someday, through hard work and perseverance, her children will manage to continue their studies until college.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene manages a village store as an additional source of income. Irene is happily married to Jhonny, a construction worker in their village. Her family lives in General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. They are blessed with three children: Aileen Mae – 13 years old, Jhon Rhey – 11 years old, and Jhon Reyven – 9 years old. All of her children are enrolled in a public school in their village. She is hoping that with her business, she can provide the school allowance of her children.

Irene wants her business to grow and she would like to avail of a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She will wisely use the loan for the improvement of her store. Irene aims to send her children through school to have a degree in college, but she is worried about the financial resources. She just hopes that through her business, she can achieve all her dreams.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling scrap materials in his community. He is 38 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Santiago, Iligan city. Joel has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Joel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 36 years old, married and has three children. They are living in Barangay General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. Marlon is glad for having a simple but happy family.

Marlon is a farmer and he manages a 1.5 hectare farm lot that supports most of their important needs in the family. He is also maintaining a tricycle transport business for additional income. He wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 that he can use for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle for the safety of his passengers.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of motorcycle

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila tiene 39 años, es una madre muy dedicada y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos, Jonathan D. 12 y Maikel D. 10, a quienes desea dar una buena educación. Su bodega es la primera en atender en su barrio, desD. las 6 D. la mañana sus puertas ya están abiertas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo D. la variedad D. la mercadería que tiene no dudan en visitar su tienda, ya que tienen la seguridad D. que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta  a Cirila D. su trabajo es vender y conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años con este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para tender su bodega, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le brinD. mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el quinto préstamo D. Cirila con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus socias, ya que es muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cirila is 39 years old, and she is a very dedicated and very loving Mom. She lives in her own home, together with her two children Jonathan aged 12, and Maikel aged 10. She wishes to proviD. them with a good education. Her convenience store is the first in the neighbourhood. She opens the doors at 6 a.m. to cater to the early morning clients. Her clientele know of the wiD. variety of merchandise in her store so they don't hesitate to patronize, knowing that they will find everything they need. What Cirila loves best about her work is the sales and chatting with her clients. She has been running the business for the past 10 years, and though she considers the hardest part is the early hours of work, she still feels the commitment to carry out her work. In the future she hopes that her business will expand and that it will proviD. her with better earnings.

This is Cirila's fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has always been on time with her payments and she will continue to be so. Among the members of the Community Bank she is very well liked, especially because she is so responsible. With the two thousand neuvos soles she will purchase products to add greater variety to her convenience store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety in merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn F. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Jovelyn is married and has 4 young children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling of scrap materials in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 32 años, vive en la casa de su padre y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se dedica es la venta de productos naturales, los cuales sale a vender puerta por puerta, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre consigue vender todos sus productos, ya que si no lo hace siente que la venta del día no fue fructífera y que al siguiente día tendrá que trabajar el doble. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que necesitan. Lleva 5 años vendiendo productos de una reconocida empresa naturista y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar tanto bajo el inclemente sol de su ciudad, es por eso que para el futuro anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender y distribuir los productos de esta marca y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y solidaria. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos naturales para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Francisca is 32 years old, and she lives in her father's house. Her greatest wish is to have a better quality of life. She sells natural products door to door. She is a very persuasive vendor and she always manages to sell-out all her products. Whenever she doesn't sell-out she feels like the day was not very productive and the day after she would have to work twice as hard. What she loves best about her jobs is to provide advice to her clients on the products that they need. She has been selling products of a well-known naturopathic brand for the past 5 years. The hardest part is to have to walk so far to sell her products and to earn an income.

This is the first loan she will receive from MFP (Kiva Field Partner), but she promises to be on time with all her payments. She is known in her Community Bank to be a very responsible and loyal member. With the one thousand nuevos soles she will pruchase more naturopathic products, to be able to provide her clients with greater variety.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie manages a vegetable vending business in their village. Every day she roams around their village to sell her products. Her husband is busy planting root crops and some vegetables that they also sell for additional income. She is glad that she can earn a weekly gross income of PHP 1,500 and she patiently budgets this to meet the needs of their family and for the maintenance of her business.

She is a good mother and willing to sacrifice everything for the welfare of her family. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders. She believes that by having this increase in capital, her business will become productive. Rosemarie is striving hard and has a strong faith in God that she can be successful in the future.

Rosemarie is only 23 years old and married to Arnel. They are living in Barangay General Balao, Solana Cagayan. They have two children: Carl – 2 years old and Caryl - 6 months old. She thanks God for all the blessings that they are receiving.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 45 años, es un hombre muy persistente con sus metas, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida. En estos últimos años se ha dedicado a vender productos naturales recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca. El poder de convencimiento que posee, junto a su carisma y buen humor, han hecho de él un vendedor muy hábil y ahora cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes estables, que siempre lo buscan para comprarle los productos que vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es recomendar a sus clientes lo que deberían usar, lleva 5 años vendiendo este tipo de productos y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar por la calles en busca de clientes, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y tiene que hacerlo. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad y comodidad.
Este es el primer préstamo de Hipólito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido pese a ser nuevo en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos naturales para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Hipolito is 45 years old and he is a very goal-minded person. He lives in his own home together with his family, and what he wants most is to be able to give them a good life. These past years he has been selling naturopathic products throughout the streets of Juliaca. He has a knack for convincing people, that, together with his charisma and good sense of humour have made him into a very apt salesperson, earning him an impressive clientele. His clients always look for him to buy the products he offers. What he loves best about his work is to recommend products to his clients. He has been selling this type of product for the past 5 years, and what he considers the toughest part to have to walk the streets in search of clients. But he knows this is his job and he just has to do it. In the future he plans on have a store where he will be able to sell his products in greater comfort.

This is the first loan for Hipolito through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows he must be timely with his payments, and he has no intention of getting into difficulties with the other members of the Community Bank. He is highly esteemed by his colleagues in the group. With the one thousand nuevos soles he will purchase a greater selection of natural products to cater to his clients' needs.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock his merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 32 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su pequeño niño Ricardo de 10 años, a quien quiere mucho y desea darle una buena educación. Su carretilla de golosinas se encuentra ubicada en uno de los parques más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Su día normalmente comienza a las 8 de la mañana y termina pasadas las 6 de la tarde, durante este tiempo ella aprovecha algunos minutos de poca venta para ir a ver a su hijo, quien estudia a unas pocas cuadras de su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar otras actividades, a la vez que cuida su carretilla de golosinas, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todo el día. Para el futuro espera poder tener una tienda donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y ofrecerles mayor variedad de productos.
Este es el primer préstamo de Paula con MFP, por lo que se siente en la responsabilidad de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su carretilla.
texts.en:
Paula, 32 years old, is a hard working mother who lives in a rented room with her young boy Ricardo, 10 years old, who she loves deeply and wants to give a good education. Her cart of sweets can be found located in one of the busiest parks in the city of Juliaca. Her day usually starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends after 6:00 in the afternoon. During this time she uses a few minutes when sales are slow to go see her son who studies a few blocks from her business. What she likes most about her work is the freedom that she has to do other activities while she is managing her sweets cart. She has eight years in this activity and thinks that the most difficult part of her work is having to remain under the harsh sun all day. For the future she hopes to be able to have a store where she can serve her clients better and offer them a greater variety of products. This is Paula's first loan with MFP, so she feels the responsibility of making her payments on time, since she wants to have access to credit in the future. In her community bank she is one of the most active members. With the 800 new soles she has requested, she will buy more sweets to improve her cart's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a fish ball and ice cream vendor in their village. She and her husband Marvic are helping one another in maintaining their business to earn a living for their family. Evelyn is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 4,000 as additional capital to make their business grow and hopefully to improve their poor living situation. They are glad that through their enterprise, they are able to send their children to school and provide them with a school allowance.

The couple are blessed with three children. Jomari -11 years old; Francisco - 9 years old, and Jeovic - 5 years old; they are all now in the elementary level. Evelyn hopes that her children will finish their studies and have a better life in the future.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth, de 29 años es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de su madre a quien quiere mucho y juntas trabajan muy duro para salir adelante. En uno de los paraderos de transporte público más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, se encuentra el kiosco de golosinas de Ruth, su negocio es muy concurrido ya que los chóferes siempre aprovechan para comer algo entre cada viaje y también es el kiosco donde la mayoría de pasajeros compra algo para el camino. Lo que más le gusta a Ruth de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y conversar con ellos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su kiosco, sin poder salir a pasear por su ciudad. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda grande de abarrotes donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. 
Este es el sexto préstamo de Ruth con MFP y al igual como hizo en sus primeros crédito desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que si no lo hace así meterá en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por lo responsable que es. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su kiosco y así ofrecerles una mayor variedad de golosinas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Ruth is a very happy young woman. She lives with her mother, whom she loves very much. They both work very hard to get ahead in life. Ruth’s snack shop is located in one of the city of Juliaca’s most important public transportation stations. Her business is much frequented because the drivers always stop by to eat something in between every trip. Her stand is where the majority of passengers purchase something to eat for the road. What Ruth most likes about her job is attending to her customers and conversing with them. She has been in business for 5 years. What she thinks is the most difficult aspect of her job is having to stay in her kiosk all day long, without being able to take a walk around her city. In the future, she would like to have a big grocery store where she can sell her products with greater comfort.

This is Ruth’s sixth loan with MFP. Just like she did with her previous loans, she intends to make her payments on time because she knows that if she doesn’t, she will cause problems in her communal bank, where she is respected for being so responsible. With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more snacks to restock her kiosk and in so doing offer her customers a greater selection.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad C. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 55 years old. Solidad is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Solidad owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Solidad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Solidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Solidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Solidad is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Solidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old. She manages a hog-raising business in the village of Burgos Ramon, Isabela where her family lives. She is thankful because she was blessed with three children: Karen Joy - 22 years old and a high school graduate, now works as an OFW (overseas Filipino worker); Kelvin - 18 years old, a high school graduate, and the youngest is Kurt Justin - 7 years old, grade one pupil.

Raising hogs is beneficial to her family because the profit gained from the business supports the needs of their family. Josephine sacrifices to earn money for her children's needs through her hog-raising business. She wants all her children to have a better future. With this in mind, she and her husband strive to earn a living. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 so that she can also have enough money to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Digmelia

texts.es:
Digmelia tiene 47 años, en su casa implementó una guardería, a la que se dedica prácticamente todo el día, ya que el cuidado de niños no es una tarea fácil. Las madres usualmente dejan a sus  pequeños desde las 7 u 8 de la mañana, cuando por motivos de trabajo salen de sus casas a buscar el sustento para su familia. Digmelia acondicionó la parte trasera de su casa con juegos didácticos con los que distrae y enseña a los niños para estimularlos al aprendizaje. Pero ella no trabaja sola, ya que tiene dos jóvenes ayudantes, quienes también atienden a los niños con mucho cariño. Para el futuro, Digmelia quiere agrandar su nido y contratar a otras personas con el fin de que otras madres se vayan tranquilas a trabajar mientras sus hijos están en buenas manos.
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y ella siempre se ha caracterizado por ser puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de juegos didácticos y algunos muebles para mejorar los ambientes de su guardería y así brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Digmelia is a 47-year-old woman who set up a daycare center in her home, working practically all day since looking after children is no easy task. Mothers usually drop their children off at 7 or 8 in the morning, when they leave their homes in order to earn a living. Digmelia equipped the back part of her house with educational games that she uses to both entertain and teach the children, which stimulates learning. However, she does not work alone; she has two young assistants who also look after the children very affectionately. In the future, Digmelia would like to expand her nest and hire more staff so that the mothers can rest assured that their children are in good hands.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has always been noted for being punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase a greater amount of educational games and some furniture to improve the atmosphere of her nursery, thus offering better services.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and educational games for her daycare center

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres, con su hermana, su esposa y sus dos hijos. Desde pequeño fue muy hábil con los trabajos manuales y sus ganas de salir adelante lo llevaron a tener un pequeño taller donde fabrica guitarras, las cuales luego de elaborarlas se las entrega a sus primos y cuñado para que las pinten y adornen. Nicolás se siente muy feliz con su trabajo, el que cada vez le resulta más rentable porque tiene muchos pedidos, por lo cual necesita expandir su negocio y tener las herramientas y materiales necesarios para mejorar, cada vez más, la calidad de sus guitarras. 
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, demostrando en su anterior crédito puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la compra de un medidor eléctrico industrial trifásico porque las herramientas que utiliza necesitan bastante potencia y el que tiene ahora no se abastece para su uso.
texts.en:
Nicolas lives with his sister, his wife and his two children in the house that his parents left for him. Ever since he was a child, he has been very skilled with his hands. His desire to get ahead drove him to set up a small shop where he makes guitars. Once he finishes them, he turns them over to his cousins and brother-in-law so that they can paint and decorate them. Nicolas is very satisfied with his business, which grows more and more lucrative because he has received many orders. For this reason, he needs to expand his business and obtain the tools and materials necessary to improve the quality of his guitars even more. This is his second loan with MFP, and he has demonstrated punctuality in making his previous loan repayments. The money that he is requesting will be used to purchase a three-phase electromechanical induction meter because the tools that he uses require more power, and what he has now is insufficient.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electricity meter

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
Norlinda used to manage a village store. However, she went bankrupt and was forced to close her store. She is now asking to borrow business capital from KIVA lenders so she can re-open her store so she can help her husband in providing for the needs of their family.

She is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP 6,000 that she can use to purchase more grocery items for her store. She hopes that this time, her business will grow towards its total development.

Norlinda is married to Generoso Sr. They have eight children and they are living in the village of Burgos Ramon, Isabela. Their eldest daughter is already married. Their second child is Generoso Jr. - 22 years old, college graduate; Generoso I - 19 years old, a college student; Roselyn - 16 years old, fourth year high school; Rose Anne - 14 years old, second year high school; Rosebelle - 12 years old, grade school; Dion Anthony -10 years old, also in grade school and Genery - 8 years old. She hopes to give them all an education, hoping for them to have a better future someday.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Gimalyn

texts.en:
Managing a general store is quite difficult, says Gimalyn, due to the factors to consider such as credit, health, and calamities. However, she remains intent on doing the business because she wants to help her husband uplift their poor living situation. She is happily married to Isabelito, who manages their rice fields. The couple have been gifted with a girl whose name is Mae Kyla, 2 years old. They are happily living in the village of Burgos Ramon, Isabela.

With the poor business situation of her store, Gimalyn is requesting Kiva lenders to allow her to borrow loan capital amounting to PHP 5,000. This amount will mean a lot towards the growth of her store.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una emprendedora mujer de 46 años, vive con su pareja, Guillermo de 50 años, y sus dos hijos; Guillermo de 19  y Milagros de 13 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad en la que incursionó debido a su necesidad de trabajar, sentirse independiente y ayudar a la economía de su familia. Rosa vende desde su casa, recibiendo los pedidos de amistades, familiares, vecinas, etc., solicitudes que una vez realizadas tardan aproximadamente de dos a tres semanas en llegar,  pero Rosa, con mucha astucia, compra los productos que vienen en oferta a precios más cómodos y luego los ofrece a sus clientas a los verdaderos precios que salen en el catálogo, es así que consigue mejores ganancias. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda en su domicilio donde pueda ofrecer con mayor comodidad su mercadería.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Rosa con MFP, ella siempre fue muy puntual en todos sus pagos, por lo que se compromete a serlo también ahora. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock y venderlos de forma inmediata, sin necesidad de esperar la llegada del pedido.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 46 year old enterprising woman, she lives with her partner Guillermo who is 50 years old, and they have 2 children: Guillermo is 19, and Milagros is 13 years old. They live in their own house. For the past 15 years she has dedicated herself to the sale of beauty products, a business that she began because she needed to work, to feel independent, and to help her family financially. Rosa sells from home and she receives orders from friends, family members, neighbors, etc. Once the products are ordered it takes approximately 3 weeks for them to arrive, however Rosa, with much astuteness, purchases the products when they are on sale and at a better price, and then offers these products to her clients at the real prices that are shown in the catalog; this way she makes better profits. In the future, she hopes to have a shop in her home where she can offer, more comfortably, her merchandise.

This is Rosa’s second loan with MFP; she has always been punctual in all her payments, as she commits to be at present. With the money that she has requested she will purchase more beauty products to have in her stock that she can sell immediately, without the need to wait for orders to arrive.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (beauty products).

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es una persona muy alegre, tiene 39 años y vive con sus 3 hijos; Jean Pierre (19), Martín (14) y Ángel (13) en su casa propia. Desde algunos años atrás se ha venido dedicando a la venta de repuestos de vehículos, pero sobre todo a la conversión del motor a gas natural. Este negocio le resulta muy rentable, pues el gas natural es mucho más económico que otros combustibles y es ecológico, por lo que su clientela va en aumento. Sofía se siente muy feliz porque sabe que irá progresando cada día más con ayuda de sus hijos, y poniéndole todo el empeño podrá mejorarlo y crecer como empresaria exitosa.
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, ella es muy puntual en todos sus pagos, además se lleva muy bien con todas las personas de su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más equipos y repuestos para vender, pues debe satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sofia is a very happy person, 39 years old, and lives with her 3 children: Jean Pierre (19), Martín (14), and Ángel (13), in her own house. For the past few years she dedicated herself to the sale of car parts, but mostly she works on converting motors to consume natural gas. This is a very profitable business, since natural gas is much cheaper than other combustibles and is also ecological; because of this her clientele is on the rise. Sofia feels very happy because she knows that every day she is progressing in her ability to help her children and she knows that by working hard she will able to improve and develop as a successful businesswoman.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, she is very punctual with her payments, and also gets along very well with all the group members. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more equipment and spare parts to sell, given that she has to satisfy her clients’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and equipment for automobiles.

loans.name: Inyh

texts.en: Inyh C. is a 21-year-old woman from Agusan del Sur. She tills a hectare of rice field, which, she says, needs additional financial support to ensure a rich harvest. Upon learning about CEVI in April 2009, she immediately joined without hesitation. Now she is requesting to borrow Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs. This loan will help Inyh in her goal to preserve her farm and produce a quality harvest.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Sallie

texts.en: 27-year-old Sallie T. is happily married to her husband of 9 years. They have 2 children. Sallie is in rice farming. She is looking for ways to get rid of the weeds that keep growing on her farm. Additional capital could also help her maintain her farm.  A new member of CEVI, she hopes for her loan of Php 6,000 to be granted. This loan will be used for farm inputs and hopefully Sallie would be able to free her farm of weeds and produce more harvest.

loans.use: farm inputs

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
D. Rahima is a 44-year-old married mother of 3 children. Rahima has sold clothes for kids and also baby carriages and toys for the past 9 years. Because of her business, she can pay her children's school expenses. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities of clothes to sell. Rahima would like to use the loan to buy more bales of a variety of clothes to increase her stock. She hopes to raise enough income to enable all of her children to finish school. More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase working capital for the purpose of business development

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly V. is a young rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is 19 years old and a single mom to a 1-year-old child. Her rice field still needs additional farm supplies. Beverly is a new member of CEVI, and she knows for a fact that its program is helpful for farmers. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to be used for additional farm supplies. Her income from her farm will be a big help to her family’s daily needs and hopefully will enable her to save up for her child’s education.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: M. Marhabo is 44 years old. She is a widow with two children. Marhabo has been running her own small business for 15 years already. She has a place in the local market for selling products such as macaroni, sweets, detergents, soap, washing powder, shampoo, toothpaste, and other items.
