She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her elder son helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. Marhabo and her son are very friendly and polite, which allows them to keep their clientele. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 US dollars. Marhabo is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods for selling, thus increasing the range of her stock. Marhabo thanks everybody who has decided to support her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON’s History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.en:
N. Uguljon is married and has three children. She runs a business selling kids' clothing. Her business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Uguljon has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in this business for 9 years.

Uguljon would like to get a loan of US$ 1000 to increase her working capital so that she can continue working to improve her business. We believe her natural ability to please her customers by perceiving their needs and offering speedy, courteous service will help Uguljon achieve her goals, sustain her success and ler her win out as an entrepreneur.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: increased working capital for her kids' clothing business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel C., 32 years old, has been a farmer for 10 years already. She faced difficulties especially financially but was still able to survive through hard work. Climate plays a big role in farming and that stays true to Maribel’s farm life. Due to extreme heat, weeds grew on her farm, making it a challenge for her to make the most of the planting season. She joined CEVI knowing its program is helpful to her and her fellow farmers. She is applied for a loan of Php 6,000 in order to purchase farm inputs. Maribel especially likes the low interest rate offered by CEVI.

loans.use: farm inputs

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en: 30-year-old Baby Jane R. is starting to see the fruit of her labor. In Agusan Del Sur, where she resides, farming is the main livelihood. Harvest time is quite near for some of the rice she planted. But the remaining rice still needs nurturing to produce a good harvest. Baby Jane joined CEVI for its financial service. She applied for a loan of Php 6,000. The loan will be used to acquire additional farm inputs.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela D., 27 years old, is a married woman and mother to 3 children. Her rice field needs additional farm inputs. In order to obtain what she needs, she joined CEVI for its financial service. She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to buy additional farm inputs. This loan will help Estela and her family cope with life’s difficulties.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline C. is a 41-year-old single woman who lives on rice farming. She has experienced failure but she also counts the success of a good harvest and still keeps on going despite challenges in farming. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because she admits she lacks financial assistance for buying farm inputs. She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000. This loan will help her purchase the additional farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: farm inputs

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina is a member of the Idunda borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 25 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 9 years old. she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Sarafina has owned  a food business selling  onions, potatoes, tomatoes for 4 years, she works 12 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 95,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Sarafina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to by more commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sarafina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onions, potatoes for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma A. is a 37-year-old mother to 6 children. She has been married for 20 years. As the main source of livelihood, farming keeps her family carrying on in life. In her farming experience, harvest depends on how much financing was spent on the farm. She had had a good deal of harvest and also dealt with only a little. She joined CEVI mainly because of its low interest rate. She has applied for Php 6,000, which will be used for farm inputs. This loan will help Vilma produce a good harvest.

loans.use: farm inputs

loans.name: Dometilla

texts.en: Dometila S. resides in Agusan del Sur where farming is the main source of living. She is 60 years of age, married for 20 years but had no children. She is anticipating a good harvest from her rice field. This is her first time borrowing from CEVI. She applied for Php 6,000. The loan will be used for farm inputs. Dometila appreciates the monthly amortization because she feels it is designed for farmers.

loans.use: farm inputs

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: A mother of 4 children, 30-year-old Marichu S. has been married for 12 years to Somy S.. She farms a hectare of rice field in Agusan Del Sur. She is about to harvest her farm but still needs additional farm inputs. She joined CEVI and applied for Php 6,000. The loan will be used to buy farm inputs. Marichu is satisfied with the low interest rate.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Aulelia

texts.en:
Aulelia is a member of the K. borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is 55 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 7 children. Her children are 35,23,22,21,20,19,18 years old. She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Aulelia has owned a clothing business selling used clothes for 20 years,. s he works 3 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Aulelia`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Aulelia hopes to save more money, get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old. She is married to Adriano. They were gifted with five children and all of them are high school graduates.

Virginia is aiming to develop her direct sales business. To do this, she is now borrowing a business capital of PHP 5,000. This amount will help her to purchase more products to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that through her hard work, she can succeed in her business someday.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Mwasham

texts.en:
Mwasham is a member of the Frelimo borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is 36 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18, 15, 12 years old.

Mwasham has owned a shop business selling commodities  like Colgate,rice, cooking oil, brush for 8 years, she works 14 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Mwasham`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mwasham hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and she is married to Edgardo, a farmer. They are blessed with three children: Mac Lloyd - 22 years old, college level; Lyzabelle - 20 years old, college graduate, and Maria Teresa - 18 years old, college student. Their family is happily living in the beautiful village of Burgos Ramon, Isabela. Their family understand cooperation and everyone is responsible; because of this, the couple is very grateful.

Teresita is requesting the amount of PHP 5,000 that will be used for the maintenance of their motor vehicle used in transportation business in their village. Her husband operates the motorcycle almost every day, aside from maintaining their farm lot. Teresita sometimes ventures into vending to assist her husband to earn a living. She is hoping that they may uplift their family from poverty and for their business to become progressive.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio G. is 42 years old and happily married to Cristeta. He manages a tricycle transport business as their source of income.  Rogelio is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.  He would like to borrow PHP 5,000.  He hopes that he can sustain all the needs of his family by managing his transport business activities well.

loans.use: Motorcycle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina's business is raising hogs.  She is 45 years old and married with six children, two of whom are already married and four are still studying.  They are living in Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. Hog raising became her family's alternative source of income and it has been a big help in meeting their needs. 

She wants to improve her business.  She is asking for a loan of PHP8,000 from the Kiva lenders.  This amount will be of great help for her small business.  She believes that her business will pave the way to success and uplift their life from poverty.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the Ngome borrower group in kihesa, Iringa. She is 49 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 25, 23, 16 years old woman, she also cares for other 1 dependents.

Grace has owned a business selling cattle for 4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profits approximately 200,00 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Grace`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more cattle for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Grace hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 40 years old and married to Romeo, a local farmer.  They have three children: Michael, 14; Jerico, 10; and Aprilyn, 7.  They live simply in Barangay Parog - Parog Solana, Cagayan. In order to support their family's needs, Criselda and her husband help each other in their vegetable production and vending business.  

Romeo maintains the vegetable production and Criselda sells their harvested vegetables. She roams around their village to sell different kinds of vegetables. Their business provides them with an income that is being wisely budgeted by Criselda to keep up with her family's needs. She wants to borrow PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders, which will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Rowelda

texts.en:
Rowelda is 33 years old and married to Dionicio. They have two children, the eldest being in elementary school.  They live peacefully in the village of Burgos Ramon, Isabela. 

Rowelda is engaged in a direct-selling business as her way of helping her husband to meet the needs of their family. She wants to continue improving her business in order to generate a larger income. For this reason, Rowelda is asking financial support from Kiva lenders.  She is requesting PHP5,000 for additional business capital. This loan will help her business towards its proper development.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a dealer of AVON, MSE and NATSHA products in the community of Barangay General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. She earns an income on a commission basis. She hopes to increase her business capital and income next month, because the peak season is at harvest time. She is hoping that she will be granted a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000, so that her direct-selling business can grow further.

Janeth is 35 years old and married to Jomar, a simple farmer. They are blessed with three children. Christine Joy is 15 years old and a high school student. Both Christian Jay, who is 9 years old, and Shajarah Mae, who is 7 years old, are elementary pupils. All of them are enrolled in a public school where cheaper tuition is charged. The village where they live is an agricultural community where the main source of income is farming. Janet intends to do her best to make her business prosper and to save for future use.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a  member of the Kichangani borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 29 year old woman,  she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 10,7, and 5 years old.

Maria has owned a food business selling local beer for 2 years, she works 4 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Maria`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like maize for local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Maria hopes to save money,pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buynmore maize for  local beer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia sells vegetables. She is married to Perfecto Sr., a tricycle driver who also manages their small farm. This couple is grateful because they have been blessed with four children: the eldest is Perfecto Jr. - 30 years old, high school graduate; then Jorelito - 26 years old, high school undergraduate; Ferdinand - 25 years old, and the youngest is Cristine Joy -16 years old, currently a high school student.

Virginia is 43 years old, yet still very strong and determined to develop her business and improve their poor living situation. She hopes to buy more vegetables to retail so that her vending income will increase. In this regard, Virginia has requested additional business capital of 4,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to further improve her business. The loan is also for the maintenance of their motor vehicle for its transportation service.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
“Be patient and always put your trust in the Lord in everything you do,” Esperanza says. Esperanza raises hogs. She is married to Castor and they are blessed with six children: Edeza - 14 years old, Carlo - 13 years old, Castor JR - 11 years old, Cathleen - 9 years old, Chenlie Joy - 3 years old, and the youngest is Charm Paul - 1 year old. They live in the village of Parog-Parog Solana, Cagayan. Through the business she manages, Esperanza is able to assist her husband in providing their family needs.

Esperanza has applied for a loan of 23,000 PHP from Kiva lenders that will be used as additional capital for her hog raising business. She will also use the loan to help her husband purchase farm supplies and feed for their hogs. She is hoping and praying for lenders to lend her the requested loan amount.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a direct dealer of DXN products in her village. She says that through this business she has been able to generate income for her family needs. She serves as the father and mother to her three children: Maricel - 30 years old, Marlon - 27 years old, and Marivil - 22 years old college student.

Nenita hopes that she can continue to support the education of her youngest. She has doubled her efforts to well manage her direct selling business to earn a bigger income. For this reason, Nenita is asking for 7,000 PHP additional capital from Kiva lenders that will be used in her DXN direct selling business for its continuous growth.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the mtivila borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 30 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18, 12,  and 4 years old.

Veronica has owned a clothing business for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Veronica`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan,Veronica hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and married to Raymundo, a company driver. They live in the village of Parog-Parog in the Solana municipality within Cagayan, the northernmost region of the Philippines. They are blessed with an eight-year-old daughter named Richelle Ayessa who is now in elementary school. Marites dreams that someday her daughter will finish her studies in college.

Marites owns a general store, and she is glad that it is doing well (she is saving some of her income to complete construction on their house). She has many customers and has always believed that good customer service and patience are important factors in developing a stable and successful business.

For the welfare of her family, Marites is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to expand her business into a grocery store. The loan will be a big help in buying more goods to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To buy additional goods with which to stock her store

loans.name: Tiba

texts.en:
Tiba is a member of the Mtwivila borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 27 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 7 and 3 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Tiba has owned a grocery business for 3 years, she works 6 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Tiba`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer and soda for her grocery.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Tiba hopes to save money, pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is married to Gaudencio and they are blessed with four children, all high school graduates. Unfortunately, their parents were not able to send them to college because it was too expensive.

Charlita is a direct seller of beauty products in their village at Barangay Burgos Ramon in Cagayan Valley's Isabela Province. According to her, selling is what makes her happy, and she is also able to support some of her family’s needs this way. She roams from house to house in their village offering her products. Charlita wants her business to be profitable so she might improve their living status.

In this regard, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to meet the demands of her customers. She believes this will help her direct sales business to grow.

loans.use: To buy more products for her direct-sales beauty supplies business

loans.name: Dyesebel

texts.en:
Dyesebel is already 51 years old. She feels lonely because they do not have a child. She and her husband, though, are very determined to have a progressive life.

Dyesebel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional business capital for her general store. Obtaining this loan would help her improve it and increase her income. She is hoping that through Kiva’s Field Partner Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: For additional capital to improve her store

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 22-year-old married man with one child. He has been working in construction since 2006. Mohamad is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a special compressor to help in his work, which will satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy a special compressor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a member of the Mtiwila borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 23, 19, 10 years old.

Neema has owned a clothing business selling used clothes for 20 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Neema first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan,Neema hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en: Gharam is a 33-year-old married woman with five young children. In 2008, she decided to open an accessories shop. She had been working in the accessories field for the past two years and knew how to manage this kind of business. Gharam wants to borrow $1,000 to increase her inventory so that she can meet the demands of the market.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Mtwivila borrower group in Kihesa ,Iringa. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 5 children, Her  children are 22,19,15, and 7 years old. she also cares   for other 2 dependents.


Flora has owned a shoes business for 1 year, she works 12 hours a a day and she earns a monthly profits approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Flora`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more shoes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, flora hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda owns a small vegetable farm in their village in Namnama Flores Naguillan, Isabela.  She use to plant different vegetables in the in lot garden. Her harvested crop is being sold to buyers or sometimes, Ermelita sells it in retail price to her neighbors. Ermelinda would like to request for a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 to be use as additional business capital to her vegetable production and vending business. She will be using the amount in purchasing new breed of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow and produce more fruits. The loan will be of big help in maintaining and growing her business shares Ermelinda. 


Ermelinda is already fifty-one years old and is married to a house carpenter in the person of Norberto A.. They are blessed with four children. Their youngest child is the only one left who is currently studying. She is now in high school and she hopes to pursue her studies until college. Ermelinda is hoping that someday, through her vegetable production their living situation will somehow become progressive.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Hà Nguyễn Thị (20201020048) is a 27 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá 14 (14).


Hà is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Hà owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Hà has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020049) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.600.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nghiêm Thị D. (20201020050) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020051) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nghiêm Thị L. (20201020052) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Nghiêm Thị Huệ (20201020053) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà Nguyễn Thị (20201020048) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá 14 (14).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020049) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nghiêm Thị D. (20201020050) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020051) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nghiêm Thị L. (20201020052) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Nghiêm Thị Huệ (20201020053) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en: Zeina is a 30-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has owned a mini market at her town since 2006 because she needed to work, to feel independent, and to help her family financially. Today, Zeina is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en: Hatem is a 34-year-old married man and the father of three young children. He has been working in concrete sales since 1998 and has 20 years of experience in this field. Today, Hatem is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional supplies for his work and to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies

loans.name: Peles

texts.en:
Peles is a member of the Mtwivila borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 30  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 11, 7, and 1 years old.

Peles has owned a clothing business selling Vitenge for 1 year, she works 9 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Peles`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge(fabric) for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Peles hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin K. is a 38 years old man, married to Rosaline Njeri. Together they have 3 children in school. He has been in the transport business for the last ten years.

This is Joseph’s  second loan from KADET. He used the first loan to service his transport car. He has never borrowed from any other micro finance institution's before. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client.

Joseph will use this loan to buy materials for sale and at the same time offer transport services to the buyers.

His future aspiration is to add more transport cars and serve more customers as his business expand.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy materials for sale, at the same time offer transport services to the buyers.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a member of the Khesa borrower group in kihesa, Iringa. She is 26 year old woman, she is single and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 7 years old.

Adelina has owned a clothing business for 6 years, she works 4 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Adelina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Adelina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is a balot vendor in the village of Cebu San Isidro, Isabela. (Balot is a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten from the shell. It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines.) She is 44 years old and married to Cesar Sr., who is a house carpenter. The couple strives hard to provide for the needs of their family. To be able to buy more balot to sell, she is asking for additional business capital from Kiva lenders amounting PHP5,000. This loan will serve as a big help to the development of her business. 

The couple is blessed with six children: Cesar D. Jr.- 25 years old and a high school graduate; Richard - 24 years old; Michelle - 23 years old; Mary Jane - 21 years old and a high school graduate; Ramon - 17 years old and studying at the high school level; and Michael - 14 years old, who is in grade school. Through developing the business, Charie could be able to help her husband improve their way of living.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda has been selling vegetables and cooked food snacks in her village for many years. She sells her own harvested vegetables by going house-to-house. Sometimes, she also buys additional vegetables from the market to sell to have a bigger income. Most of the time, her income is being used to support the needs of her family. Rosalinda would like to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She would be very thankful if she could borrow 4,000 PHP. She hopes that her request will be approved because her business is the only source of income that can help her family cope with their poor living situation.

Rosalinda is 45 years old. She is a very patient businesswoman in their village in the district Saranay of Barangay Flores Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to a farmer, Ricardo M., who is 48 years old. They have four children: three are already grown up and finished their studies up to secondary school only. Their youngest is just four years old and not yet in school.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is engaged in vegetable vending business. She is married to Ronillo, a farmer. She is 29 years old and blessed with two children who were still young. She is thankful because her husband helps her in the business she manages. Improving the business is what she aims for in order to support her two children future education. She wanted to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional capital. She hopes that she could avail the amount of loan she is requesting for she believes it is of big help in the improvement of her vending activity. 

Wilfreda further shared that her daily vending income was utilized to provide for their daily immediate needs at home. Some of her income was being saved for their future family use. With loan she had requested, Wilfreda is hoping that her business become productive to give their children a secure living condition.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: Z. Anne-Marie est née vers 1959 à Adjarra. Anne-Marie est mariée à KOULIHO Marcellin. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, tous scolarisés dont trois sont les leurs. La famille vit à Adjarra. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Anne-Marie vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. En effet, Anne-Marie vend de façon ambulante les chaussures et layettes ainsi que la bouillie de maïs.  Anne-Marie est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne-Marie demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de chaussures et layettes.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is engaged in hog raising business for 15 years.  Aside from that, she also sells fish in their village. She is still aiming for her enterprise to become progressive.  She wanted to avail a loan of PHP4,000 for her livestock.  She will invest it for their growth and for her business to grow. 

She hopes that lenders will support her business because she also wanted to provide complete education for her two children who are presently studying. Her eldest child finished her nursing course in college because of her business and now her second child is already studying in college level. Her youngest child is already in high school. She is glad that her husband who is operating a tricycle transport is always there to support for their daily needs.

loans.use: Additonal Capital

loans.name: Kèmi

texts.fr: K. Kèmi est née vers 1955 à Adjarra. Kèmi est mariée à GBEMENOU Houdji. Le couple a quatre enfants dont trois sont encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Adjarra. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Kèmi vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des divers (chaussures, bols, bassines, vêtements…) que Kèmi vend de façon ambulante. Kèmi est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Kèmi demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
K. Kèmi was born around 1955 in Adjarra. She is married to GBEMENOU Houdji. The couple have four children of whom three are still in their care. The family lives in Adjarra. Thanks to the revenues from her business, Kèmi comes to the aid of her husband in regards to family expenses. What Kèmi sells is a variety of goods (shoes, bowls, tubs, clothing...) as she goes from door-to-door. She is an ALIDé client who repays her loans. To satisfy her customers further, she's asking for a loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a bagoong  (processed and fermented fish) vendor.  She is 55 years old and married to Rolando Sr., a farmer.  The couple have four children, and two of them are still studying.  Marina is still active in managing her buy and sells business of bagoong or sometimes called fish sauce. 

She is requesting to avail loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 that will be of big help in the improvement of her business which is very in demand in their village.  She buys bagoong all the way from the province of Pangasinan and retails in their village at Barangay Cebu San Isidro, Isabela. She hopes to develop her business to progress to able increase her income that is being used for the completion of education of her two younger children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr: A. Ramatou est née vers 1971 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Ramatou est mariée à AVOCETIEN Elie, un tôlier. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont encore à leur charge. C’est Ramatou et son mari qui assurent les dépenses de la famille. Ramatou y arrive grâce au revenu de son activité. Ramatou vend en effet des fournitures de bureau  de façon ambulante. Ramatou est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour  augmenter le volume de son activité par ces temps de rentrée scolaire, Ramatou demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Ramatou was born around 1971 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to AVOCETIEN Elie, a sheet metal worker.  The couple have three children who are all in school.  Two of them are still in their care.  Ramatou and her husband ensure that family expenses are covered.  Ramatou manages to do so, thanks to the revenues from her business.  Basically, she sells office supplies door-to-door.  She is an ALIDé client who repays her loans.  To increase her business volume for this return-to-school season, she is asking for a loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy office supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 30 years old. She is a vegetable vendor in their village in Flores, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Ernesto, a farmer and they have two children: Maiden Joy, 17 years old and old while Richelle, 14 years old, high school student.  Ofelia wishes that her children will finish their studies and earn a college degree someday.  She believes that with her diligence and through her hard work, she can achieve her dreams.

Ofelia sells her vegetables every morning.  She wanted to improve her business, thus, she is now requesting to avail a loan of PHP4,000.00.  Aside from improving her vegetable business, she is also planning to sell frozen foods for additional income.  She is hoping that she’ll be given the chance to become progressive in her business endeavor. Her loan will be of great help in attaining her goals in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Charlotte Constance

texts.fr: A. Charlotte Constance est née le 12/12/1959 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Charlotte Constance est mariée à KIKI Lambert. Le couple a deux enfants. La famille vit à Porto-Novo. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Charlotte Constance vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des tissus, chaussures et ustensiles de cuisine que Charlotte Constance vend. Charlotte Constance achète ses tissus à Cotonou,  Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin et les vend au marché Ouando de Porto-Novo. Charlotte Constance est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour  augmenter le volume de son activité, Charlotte Constance demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de tissus, chaussures et ustensiles de cuisine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet manages a small variety store located in the front of her house. She has been selling grocery items at retail prices. However, due to lack of capital, she has very limited stock of merchandise displayed in her store to sell. Therefore, she is now applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items for her store. She prays that her lenders will support her business to meet the needs of her children.

Juliet is 32 years old and is currently residing in district Progreso of Barangay Flores Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Rhodienito, a policeman in their town. They are blessed with three children: two are already in school. "Time goes by so fast," says Juliet. Soon all her children will be entering school and, as much as possible, she wants to be prepared for their education. She really hopes for the approval of her loan, because it will help her a lot in restoring her business, which will also be very beneficial for her children.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a vegetable vendor. Improving their way of living motivated her to venture into the business. She believes that the business will be a big help to her husband, who manages their farming business. She is a mother of four: Rogelio - 12 years old, first year high school; Roda - 9 years old and Mary Grace - 8 years old, both elementary students, and Rodolfo P. Jr. - 4 months old.

Maribel really wants to help her husband provide for their needs at home. She decided to borrow 5,000 PHP that she can use for her business. She hopes that her small enterprise will continue to be productive.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy N. is 47 years old and a mother of nine children - of which, two are in high school, one is in grade school and the rest are grown. She is married to Reynaldo N., a 52 year-old farmer. Daisy, together with her husband, work hard to earn and provide for the future of her children. The family lives in the village of Sto. Cagay, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

Daisy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 and testifies that it was through NWTF-Project Dungganon that she has achieved some of her dreams - to be able to send her children to school, have her own business to supplement the income that her husband earns as a farmer, and to have some savings for the future.

She started her business by selling fruits (bananas, etc.), which were delivered by a wholesaler, to their neighbors from a stand set up outside her house. Later, she expanded her product offerings, including groceries and other commodities. Additionally, she raised pigs in her backyard. Her business activities earned about PHP 8,000 per month, which was significant in helping to improve her family's quality of life.

Her previous 8th cycle loan amounting to PHP 14,000. She paid back the loan in full and on-time without any delays in any of the weekly installments. She is now borrowing PHP 16,000 for her 9th cycle loan. She plans to use the money as revolving capital to offer more products in her "sari-sari", also known as a "general store". She intends to use the profits from this loan cycle to pay for her children's tuition and to provide them with their daily allowance.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To have revolving capital for her general store

loans.name: Verly

texts.en:
Verly is a food snack vendor in Cebu Village, San Isidro, Isabela. According to her, she is generating a net income of PHP 300 each week, which she puts towards her family's daily basic needs. In order to develop her business, Verly is seeking the assistance of KIVA lenders. She would like to borrow the amount of PHP 5,000 to reinvest into her business to increase her daily income.

Verly is married to Robertson Sr., and the couple is blessed with five children. Her eldest daughter is married, while the other four are still young and attending school. The couple is doing everything to support their children's education. Verly wants to provide her children with the best that she can afford because they are her treasures in life. She is praying that they may somehow be able to overcome whatever challenges that they face in their lives.

loans.use: To reinvest into her snack foods vending business.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is engaged in hog raising business. She is requesting to avail a loan of PHP4, 000 because she wanted her business to maintain and somehow expand into poultry business. She is planning to purchase additional piglets.  The loan she is requesting will be of big help to the pursuance of her business into progress thus she is working hard. Moreover, the business is also of big help to their family needs.

Belinda is now 37 years old. She is a hog raiser from the village of Flores Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Eduardo who is a farmer and they are blessed with three children who are all studying. Their eldest is already in college while the other two are already in their high school. She is hoping to support their studies until they complete their education in college. Hopefully through her business and with the help of her husband, they could continuously support their educational needs.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is a vegetable vendor in her village. Most of the time, the vegetables that she sells were grown in her backyard. Sometimes she purchases additional vegetables from a nearby market, which she sells for a greater profit. Delia is 35 years old and married to Federico, a farmer, with whom she has two young children. She hopes that her business will be able to provide her children with a complete education.

Delma would like to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase farming materials, such as fertilizer, pesticide and seeds. Through these efforts, she will be able to expand the variety of vegetables that she can offer and eventually eliminate the need to buy vegetables from the market.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials, such as fertilizer, pesticide.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is happily married to Ruben. The couple helps each other so that they could sustain the needs of their family. Emily is selling native cakes.  Aside from this, she also buy and sell salted eggs in wholesale price and sell in retail price.  Her income in the business is very helpful in sending their children to school and to their daily needs at home. Her desire of improving the business gives her the idea of requesting for additional business capital from KIVA lenders. She hopes to avail the amount of PHP5, 000. 

Emily knows how to make salted eggs because sometimes, she is just purchasing ducks eggs in the market and will be the one doing the process of making salted eggs. The process is very easy said Emily. Having the knowledge of making salted eggs motivated her to work harder aiming to have bigger capital in order to buy ducks that produces eggs for her salted making. But for now, since she doesn’t have the needed capital, Emily will patiently improve her vending till she could reach out for her dreams.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Letecia is a resident from the village of Flores Naguilian, Isabela. She is happily married to Herminigildo, who is a teacher in their village. They have six children, most of whom are already grown. Some of her children have their own families and live on their own, but they still maintain communication.

Letecia has three pigs, which she raises to generate income. She is asking for the support of KIVA lenders because she does not have enough capital to purchase feed for her pigs. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Veronica Jerotich

texts.en:
Veronica is a 55 years old widow. She is a mother of ten children who solely depend on her. Her residential place is Levegeya in Eldoret.

Veronica B. was introduced to KADET by a member. She has applied for a school loan to pay her children's school fees. She has a small scale business which she believes will be able to 

She wants to be able to educate her children to the highest level of education in order for them to acquire the best education which she believes will be her biggest investment.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: L. Célestine est née vers 1954 à Sakété. Elle est mariée à Robert, un chauffeur de la Cour Suprême à la retraite déjà. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Sègbèya à Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Célestine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Célestine vend des ustensiles de cuisine (bassines, seaux, porte savon…), des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.), de charbon de bois et de la pâte de maïs. Célestine achète ses articles à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin et les vend chez elle à domicile. Célestine est une ancienne cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour  augmenter le volume de son activité, Célestine demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
L. Célestine was born around 1954 in Sakété.  She is married to Robert, an already-retired chauffeur of the Supreme Court.  The couple have three children, who are all in school.  Two of them are still in their care.  The family lives in Sègbèya in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Thanks to the revenues from her business, Célestine comes to the aid of her husband in regards to family expenses.  She sells kitchen utensils (basins, buckets, soap dishes,...); and various items, such as candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, and candles; and charcoal; and pâte de maïs (a kind of boiled polenta).  Célestine purchases her goods at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. And she sells them out of her home.  She is a former Alidé client who indeed repays her loans.  To increase her business volume, she is asking for a loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and charcoal

loans.name: Chérifath

texts.fr: H. Chérifath a trente cinq ans. Elle est mariée à METONOU Rafiou. Chérifath est mère de trois enfants. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Chérifath vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des fruits (ananas, bananes, oranges, carottes, poivrons, choux, papayes, etc.) et divers (boîtes de sardines, de tomate, de thon, des œufs, de l’oignon, des légumes, de mayonnaise, de petit pois…) que Chérifath vend. Chérifath a déjà eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité.  Pour  continuer de développer son activité, Chérifath demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
H. Chérifath is 35 years old.  She is married to METONOU Rafiou and is the mother of three children.  The family lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Thanks to the revenues from her business, she is helping her husband to cover family expenses.  Chérifath sells fruit (pineapples, bananas, oranges, carrots, peppers, cabbage, papayas, etc.) and a variety of items (canned sardines, tomatoes, and tuna, eggs onions, vegetables, mayonnaise, peas...).  She has already had three ALIDé loans and has repaid them.  She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business.  To continue to develop her business, she's asking for a loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roida

texts.en:
Roida is a member of the Liloloa borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa. She is 44 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 20, and 13 years old. Also she cares for other 1 dependent.

Roida has owned a charcoal business for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Roida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to by more charcoal for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Roida hopes to save more money ,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Nathalie Madinatou

texts.fr: A. Nathalie Madinatou est née vers 1975 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Nathalie Madinatou est mariée à DOUROSSIMI Wakili. Nathalie Madinatou est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Nathalie Madinatou vit à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Nathalie Madinatou arrive à satisfaire ses propres besoins. C’est des tissus que Nathalie Madinatou vend. Nathalie Madinatou a besoin de moyens financiers pour mieux développer son activité. C’est la raison pour laquelle  Nathalie Madinatou demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Nathalie Madinatou was born around 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to DOUROSSIMI Wakili and is the mother of two children, who are both in school.  Nathalie Madinatou lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Thanks to her business, she manages to support herself.  What she sells is cloth.  She needs funds to develop her business further. This is why she's asking for a loan, so as to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: A. Pierrette vit à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Pierrette est mère de quatre enfants. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Pierrette vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des mèches et des produits de coiffure  que Pierrette vend. C’est au Nigeria, Etat voisin du Bénin ainsi qu’à Lomé, capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Pierrette achète ses produits. Pierrette a déjà eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité.  Pour  continuer de développer son activité, Pierrette demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Pierrette lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is the mother of four children.  Thanks to the revenues from her business, she comes to the aid of her husband in meeting family expenses.  Pierrette sells hair extensions and haircare products.  She purchases her products in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin, as well as in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She has already had three loans with ALIDé and has repaid them.  She was able to use those loans to raise her level of business.  To continue developing her business, Pierrette is asking for a loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, wigs, and hair care products (shampoos, straighteners, ointments…)

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Esta is a member of the Kiloloa borrower group in Kihesa ,Iringa. She is 42 year old woman, she is widowed and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 23, 20, 18, and 12 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Esta has owned a business selling potatoes, banana for 1 year, she works 12hours  a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 60,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Esta`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more potatoes, tomatoes and banana for sale.

With the  additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Esta hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  tomatoes, potatoes, onions

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Living in a sugarcane plantation, locally known as a "hacienda", and earning a living as a hacienda worker is hard because you need to wake up very early around 4:30 AM to perform backbreaking work for very low wages with very little benefits. What's worse, the work is seasonal - usually work is available only from October to April, and then when sugar milling season starts, from May to September, work in the hacienda is intermittent at best.

This was the experience of Nancy F., a 38 year-old, who is married to Berdandin F., a 46 year-old. A few years back, Berdandin stopped working in the hacienda and started selling ice buko (frozen young coconut meat and juice) around their community because it earned more income than working for a daily wage in the sugar cane fields.

Seeing how much income her husband earned selling ice buko, Nancy joined in the efforts. She soon had many loyal customers in the local school, market and nearby villages. As demand for her product grew, Nancy's business became limited by her working capital. This made her decide to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 so that she could access the microcredit line, so that she could increase her selling capacity.

The loans she received from NWTF-Project Dungganon helped her to increase their income capacity. In addition to her ice buko business, Nancy also saw the opportunity to earn additional income by selling rice to her neighbors in the hacienda and neighboring villages. Later, she also bought a motorcycle, on installment, for her husband to provide transportation services. The vehicle is called "habal-habal"; it is a single motorcycle that can carry multiple passengers at a time, although it could be hired on a per trip basis to carry only one or two passengers or a load of goods. The motorcycle will be fully-paid in a few months time.

Nancy is happy with how her life is going. Her only child, who is now 17 years old is attending college and has a bright future. Her family's quality of life has greatly improved from the poverty that they previously experienced; all because they worked hard and concerted all their efforts towards the goal of moving out of poverty.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To increase their income capacity.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, detergents and other products in her grocery. She is 33 years old, widowed and has two children. Rahima has been running the grocery store for the past five years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Rahima is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Rahima is trying to sustain her business and has requested a loan of $800 US to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Rahima reach all of her aspirations.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Tubhuke Group

texts.en:
Kuruthum I. is 32 years old and married with three children, a nine year-old and a pair of two year-old twins. She sells textiles, such as sarongs, linens and fabrics. She started this business three years ago and works from 7am to 4pm daily. She earn a profit of about $77 per month.

This will be Kuruthum’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she hopes will increase her business capital.

Kuruthum will share this loan with her loan group, Tubhuke, which has 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Kuruthum is in the back row, third from the left.

loans.use: To increase her business capital.

loans.name: Olimboy

texts.en:
K. Olimboy is a 53 year-old married man. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. Olimboy has been running the business of raising and selling cattle. He has 10 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Olimboy has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. Now Olimboy wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So that he applied for a loan of $ 800 USD. Olimboy thanks all lenders for their support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
N. Zulfiya has 10 years of experience selling dried fruits. She is 43 years old and married. She uses all the money she makes to take care of her three children and provide for their education. Zulfiya always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, Zulfiya requests 4000 somoni to purchase dried fruits for processing in order to increase the variety of her goods. Zulfiya expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en:
Abdumanon is a hardworking person and he has been providing taxi services for two years. He is 52 years old and the father of three children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. The most important thing to him is that his children enter university and successfully finish it, so that they will be professionals and have a better future. Abdumanon wishes to keep his taxi business growing and for this he needs to have tools in good working order. Abdumanon needs to buy spare parts and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to his work, he has been able to stabilize their quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi

loans.name: Soline

texts.fr: A. Soline est née vers 1964 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Soline a fait jusqu’au cours secondaire avant d’abandonner les études. Soline est mariée à NOUKPO Antonin. Soline est mère de trois enfants. La famille vit à Cotonou. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Soline vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) et des articles de mercerie que Soline vend. Soline a besoin de moyens financiers pour mieux développer son activité. C’est la raison pour laquelle Soline demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Soline A. was born around 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Bénin. Soline went to school up until high school before abandoning her studies. Soline is married to Antonin Noukpo. Soline is the mother of three children. The family lives in Cotonou. Thanks to her business's income, Soline helps her husband with the family's expenses. Soline sells various items (candies, cookies, cans of milk, of sardines, of tomatoes, sugar, pasta, laundry, dish and bath soaps, batteries, candles, etc.) and sewing supplies. Soline needs financial means to further develop her business. It is for this reason that Soline is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items (Candies, cookies, cans of milk, of sardines, of tomatoes, sugar, pasta, bathroom tissue, etc.) et sewing supplies.

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en:
Muhaiyo is 20 years old. She is very energetic girl and already running her own business to support her parents with household expenses. Four years ago she started selling kid’s clothing with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past 4 years, Muhaiyo has successfully operated her business at the market. Now she wishes to enlarge her inventory and with that purpose she applied to IMON International. Muhaiyo has requested a loan of $ 800 USD. An optimistic girl, Muhaiyo plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for kids for autumn season.

loans.name: Magfirat

texts.en:
Magfirat U. is 42 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. To support her family, Magfirat is selling clothing for kids. She has been in this business for two years. During these years, she has gained experience in choosing goods of good quality that meet the requirements of clients with various levels of income. 

The business is very stable and that allows Magfirat to improve the living standards of her family. Magfirat has been working with IMON for more than two years. She managed her previous loans with accuracy and performed all the payment in a timely manner. 

Today Magfirat requests a $800 loan in order to expand her inventory for selling. Magfirat would like to thank everyone supporting her and will ensure that she’ll pay the loan in time.
